Name: Midnight Crossroad (A Novel of Midnight, Texas)

ReviewList.Text: Please know now that I've read Mz Harris's books since high school. I love mysteries and strong plots, and usually, Harris's writing has never let me down. Until now. I'm not going to rip into the woman but I will say this is the first book I've read of hers where I was bored reading it. Worse than hating it, I didn't care about any of the characters or there problems. I think it was because all th characters had secrets, so many secrets, that i wasn't able to identify with any of the characters. When the mystery was solved  and the killer revealed, I still couldn't care. I liked Figi well enough, but everybody (the characters) guarded their back stories so well that it  made them all dull. When Harris let me know interesting bits about her Midnight cast, it was too little too late. Sad to say, I didn't enjoy reading this book; I dredged through it. Ignore or believe me -your choice. I'm so sorry Mz Harris.

Being a big Charlaine Harris fan, especially the Harper Connelly and Lily Bard series, I was excited that the Manfred Bernardo character was going to have his own trilogy, crossing paths with the Bobo Winthrop character. What surprised me was the unexpected and jarring crossover into the Sookie world of vampires and supers. That was unfortunate, but the appearance of a talking cat pretty much completed the disappointment. Manfred, no longer a very interesting character, did pretty much nothing with his psychic abilities. That may come up in the following books but I'm unlikely to buy them.
Depressing, boring and pointless book. Loved the Sookie Stackhouse, Harper Connelly and Lily Bard books but this one is a dud.  I was so looking forward to it, too.

I am a big fan of all Ms Harris' books, and of all of the characters in all of her series, and so was very keen to read this one.  But I was really disappointed in this book.  Ms Harris has always managed to give depth and humanity to her characters - even if you don't like them you understand them.  And her story telling generally has depth, pace and texture. This book, however, reads like a short story. There is little depth, the story line seems to bounce around, and her characters seem two dimensional.  Even characters we already knew well, like Bobo Winthrop, seem almost caricatures of their earlier incarnations. I guess it is being set up for the next books in the series.  But, unlike the Sookie Stackhouse, Lily Bard, Harper Connelly, or Aurora Teagarden seres, I didn't finish this book wanting to know what happens next.  I will not be rushing to buy the next instalment. t.

Alas I have to agree with what everyone else has written here about this being VERY disappointing.  More than 200 pages in & nothing had happened!  Far too much detail about nothing.  And then NO detail about things that really needed it - i.e.  what sort of 'world' is this?  Is it 'normal' to everyone to have 'energy/blood' sucking vampires wandering around? And talking cats?  I could go on, but I think it has been summed up well enough in the above reviews.  I only finished the book because I was hoping it might pick up; alas it didn't.  If this had been an up & coming author I would have stopped reading well before the finish and written it off as an amateur starting out, who needed a LOT more practise.  Her editors did not do their job on this one.  Loved her other works, but a big thumbs down to this one.

Thank goodness I checked this out of the library instead of buying it. I found the descriptions of the strange town and its quirky characters too drawn out and totally unengaging. Lost all interest in the middle of Chapter 3 and decided to return it unread which is unusual for me.

I usually live Charlaine's novels but thus one was super slow to start and I had a hard time getting into it. The story was not as great either. I know it's the beginning of a series but Im not sure if I'll visit Midnight again. And by the way......not all right wing people are racist, gun toting idiots. I felt she could have chosen something else to label the bad guys with.
Loved Sookie books ( early ones) This is bad. Really bad. Who are the 128 people paid to give 5 star reviews?  They could not have read this book. Boring set up, boring characters. Painful.

I kept waiting for the story to switch gears and engage my imagination, but no such spark occurred. The characters had promise but  the Midnight Crossroad never did catch. Good ideas and nice grammar and punctuation but no life. I finished it, hoping til the end something would come alive. I'll not read another of hers early, but wait for the reviews.

I loved the Sookie series. It is hard for me to believe the same person who wrote the Sookie series, rich with great characters and relaxed storytelling is the same author who penned this .... well....mess. Her attempt to write first person from a man's view was just awful. No man thinks like the main character with as another reviewer put it, long boring and unnecessary descriptions of shoes and body types rather than in-depth characterization. The only redeeming character was the cat but that was already overdone elsewhere. It was awful and I hate to be the one to say it. I was so excited to read it, and I was so disappointed to be skimming pages hoping something good might come of it all, only to have hopes dashed cruelly! Don't bother with this one....
I was so disappointed. This book left me bored to tears. I had to make myself finish it., and even skipped several pages just to make it end.

I'm a super Charlaine Harris fan- love all the Sookie books. And being from Texas; well I was prepared to like this one a lot! As it turns out, it was only ok. The characters just didn't seem as "believable" as all the ones in the Sookie Stackhouse series (yes, if you read her, you know shape shifters and vampires can be very believeable as "people"). It just wasn't the page turner I hoped for and expected.

I've read every other book Charlaine Harris has written -- and enjoyed every one of them. She creates interesting characters and stories you can't put down. Until this one! I'm 25% into Midnight Crossroad and won't finish it. I hate to say it because I've always been such a fan of hers, but this book reads as though she is simply burned out. The characters are odd but not interesting. The setting is unexciting and not interesting. I'm really sad that the only thing I like about this book is the title!

I really didn't care for Ms Harris' latest book. I found the characters uninteresting and the mystery unexciting. It was too dark and grim for a cozy summer mystery novel. If this is an example of current southern gothic literature I'm going to pass on the genre in the future.

Having been a fan of the Southern Vampire series for years (even back in the days when no one had ever heard of True Blood!), I was excited when I saw Charlaine Harris coming out with a new series. But if you're expecting this book to be at all similar to that series, you will be inevitably and severely disappointed. To be fair, I probably should have read the cover description in a bit more detail, but I'm willing to try anything by one of my favorite authors. Honestly though? This book bored me. I thought about quitting part way through. I care not for Manfred, Bobo, Olivia, etc. Characters were flat, the writing wasn't interspersed with zippy lines. I can't say that I won't read another Charlaine Harris book ever, but I will be waiting until she finishes this series and/or starts another.

A big disappointment.  I wish I had read the reviews before purchasing this book (solely because it is written by Charlaine Harris). I have read and loved the majority of her other series- from Sookie Stackhouse to Aurora Teagarden. My mistake for taking it for granted that this story would be as engaging as Harris' other books. I found it boring and that her characters were shallow and uninteresting.  Although I see where she is attempting to build a series' foundation,  I am not the least bit motivated to pursue the next book.

I kept hoping it would get better and it never did.  I would not recommend this book and I am seriously considering reading anything further from this author.  My advice would be to not waste your time or money on this book.

I'm proud of myself for finishing this book in the same way I'm proud of myself for finishing a task I've been postponing forever. Like cleaning out the fridge or trying on my old jeans from college so I can finally...finally...get rid of them. This book had promise-- characters with whimsical abilities, but these abilities were never fully explored. Heck. They were hardly even USED! Talk about wasted potential. Pass on this one. Harris has got other, more entertaining books out there. This one is kind of sad.

I've followed Charlaine Harris' complete career. I've read most everything she has put out. This was way below her standards. The protagonist isn't even remotely interesting, the rest of the characters are boring as all get out and the plot took entirely too long to develop. The ending was the only thing that was interesting. It was unexpected and reflective of what I wish she would write. Talk about the evil and what everyday (as much as this cast of characters could be) people do to deal.

After the spectacular rip-off of 'After Dead', I was so disappointed and angry I was sure I would never buy another Charlaine Harris book again, but time passed and I remembered how much I had loved her many books.  So, despite the plethora of bad reviews, I bought it.  Let me now apologize profusely to my fellow readers.  I should have listened to you and saved my money.  This book is just plain awful.  I find it hard to believe Ms. Harris actually wrote it, despite Manfred being a main character and the references to Harper and Lily from other series.  The writing is stilted, the plot ridiculous, and the characters little more than cartoon shadows.  My best guess is that it was actually written by a grand-daughter, a niece, or some random 13 year old as a massive joke.  I solemnly swear I will never by another book by Ms. Harris.  I feel like like I lost a friend, but I also feel as if I've been hoodwinked by someone I used to care for.  Fool me once...

Between the RIDICULOUS names, flat characters, and snooze-worthy pace, I gave up about a little over half way through. Midnight Crossroad has no personality, no spark at all. Charlaine Harris used to be one of my top 5 favorites, but after the last few Sookie Stackhouse "filler & fluff" books, I just don't know about her anymore.

You may not think this review is worth much but I needed to get some closure on my feeling about this book. I am a fan of Charlaine Harris and have been for several years. I keep some of her books to read again. This is hard for me to say but "Midnight Crossroad" was a book I had to wade though. I found myself falling a sleep and skipping pages. I never thought that would ever happen reading a book by Harris. Her characters were not real to me and the story line did not grab me as so many of her other books did. If this is her attempt to start another series, I don't think I will be reading it.

I'm glad someone gifted me the kindle version & that I didn't pay for Midnight Crossroad. It wasn't very interesting, nothing unique, same formula as Ms. Harris' other plot lines - just less interesting. Oh, & the southern charm thing felt really false in this book.

I've read several of Charlaine Harris' books, my favorites being the first six Sookie Stackhouse. I had hope for this book, but was disappointed. Midnight Crossroad is a very small town inhabited by a group of people with secrets - sounds like it should be pretty interesting.  But none of the characters (even as a group) are strong enough to carry the book. Several ring false because they are not developed enough; I really didn't empathize with any of them. The plot was okay but unmemorable. I think Ms. Harris needs to slow down her turnout of books and focus on depth and dimension of both characters and plot.

The only way that this new series has a chance to become interesting is if Sookie shows up with Eric, Bill, and Sam and they gooble up the whole town of Midnight so Charlene Harris can start all over. The book starts to become mildly intetesting near the last 1/4 of the book. Some of the characters were unnecessarily over developed (Chuy, Joe, Rev, etc). She did throw in a vampire but he was a bore.  I am convinced that the reviewers who are giving this book high stars NEVER read this book. I love Charlene Harris but this was a disappointment.

I've read all Harris's previous books, mundane as well as fantastic. I had high hopes for this one. But NOT ONE of the people were interesting nor were any of them likable. I gave up a dozen or two pages in.

Starts very out really good but fades to dust very early. It is not well written and the character development is terrible. The author assumes that anyone reading this novel has already read her other books, which I have not. I was looking forward to a good read and getting hooked on a new series, but I was sadly disappointed. The characters are not convincing and certain situations were, for lack of a better word, silly! A terrible book, it couldn't hold my interest long enough for me to finish.

I enjoyed reading the Sookie Stackhouse series (up until the last few) and I enjoyed the world that Ms Harris created for Harper Connelly, so I went into Midnight Crossroad with high expectations. Were those expectations met? I am still undecided. Usually I can read a book quickly, but this one seemed to drag on. There are some interesting characters here, but I could not get invested in any of them. I think that having their backstories so mysterious meant that I really didn't care enough about them. All the characters had the potential to be interesting and I assume that the next 2 books in the trilogy will give us more backstory, but it might be too late. The plot seemed to plod along very slowly and I was waiting for something exciting to happen, but unfortunately it never did. I am unsure whether I will continue with this series or not.
This is a Disappointing book, expected more from this author. There is unnecessary violence and the characters are shallow. I would not recommend it.
Not up to Sookie Stackhouse stories, it was flat and not at all intriguing.  I found this book an effort to finish and the only reason I kept reading was that I was sure it would get better

always thought there was more to Manfred Bernardo than was to be found in other books so this was the chance to find out more, was even interested by adverts that mentioned a big secret ... more disappointment ... after the last Stackhouses that were sort of "filler books" I expected Harris to come out with all guns blazing ... decent mystery story but certainly not what it should have been

Not very good.  I've loved CH books for years, but after the way she ended the SVM, I decided to read this one after checking it out from the library.  I'm glad I made that decision.  It rooks me two weeks to get through this book, when a Sookie Stackhouse book was finished same day!  I am a big reader, but I could not get into the characters, nor did I care about them.

It took me until almost half way through the book to care about any of the characters. I wanted to like this book because I loved the Sookie books, but it just wasn't as interesting. There were a couple of parts that had me turning pages, but for the most part I just didn't care much for Midnight Crossing.

Sore disappointment!  I'm a huge fan of Charlaine Harris but this book is uninteresting.  Usually I cannot put her books down and I had to force myself to keep trying to finish this one!  Bad Book! I agree with all the other critical reviews of this book.

This first of the series novel just doesn't have the charm of the first stackhouse book. It feels like Harris is just planting characters as fodder for future books in the series, but failing to make them very 3-dimensional. Hoping the series improves.

So far below the measure of her last two series. Very slow-moving plot. None of the characters is wildly appealing, and most remain two-dimensional. That said, it is just interesting enough to keep you reading to the end. But barely.
Not worth the time. Honestly. Return it if you can. Borrow it if you feel like you must read it.

I highly enjoyed Charlaine Harris's vampire series so I had high hopes for this one, to say the least. Unfortunately, it just didn't live up to those expectations. This whole story read more as an introduction, with lots of description and talk about who/what the characters are...but very little plot. It was a slog, to say the least.
Very slow start...didn't enjoy this book very much. The storyline dragged on and was just boring. It got interesting toward the end, but by then I was just ready for it to be over.
I used to like her books but no more for me

This didn't seem like it was written by Charlaine Harris. For the first time ever, one of her books had wording that seemed a little awkward and didn't pull me in. I've read all her series, and this one wasn't nearly as good as the others.

I don't want to go into crazy specifics, but this book was different and odd with a cast of characters that  I found it hard to enjoy. Harris went back and forth with her writing style and I know why - she was trying to give it a quirky and magical feel. I guess if I wouldn't have had preconceived notions about Harris' writing - I would have like this novel better. She did a good job - it was compelling, it just wasn't what I was ready for and it wasn't for me. I do believe people that enjoy quirky reads with a cast of characters that aren't out of a CW casting - you'll really enjoy this. Again it wasn't an inbetween book for me because of the plot or the characters or the story - it just wasn't what I was expecting and I couldn't get into the right headspace for it.

I have read all of Charlaine Harris' series and enjoyed them each one.  Although I read this entire book, it didn't improve and bother to develop any depth or emotion.  Even the characters she salvaged from other series lost all their appeal.  Very disappointing.

Have read other books by her, I like that they are a little different.  But I would have to agree with another reviewer that said the characters had potential but never got there.  Also, I read fictional books to escape the everyday.  She needs to keep her left-wing, right-wing political crap out of the book.  I hear enough of this on the radio & tv.  The word is ESCAPE!
Slow. Hard to stay focused on this one. Wouldn't recommend the book to Harris readers. Maybe too compared to Sookie

I loved the Sookie Stackhouse series at least up until the last 3 books. It seemed like she had no idea how to end a series on a high note and just beat it into the ground because she made good money on it with Trueblood being made and what not. That being said I picked up midnight crossroad with no expectations and that's a good thing because in my opinion it was dull. All the characters had weird names which annoyed me throughout and I felt no connection to any of the characters, and when things got revealed I didn't care I just kept reading to finish it. I don't think I'll be buying anymore of her books, not just in this series but also other books to come.

I loved the whole Sookie series so much I practically devoured them. This is the second time I've attempted to read one of her books about characters other than those in her southern vampire series. Sadly, I just could not get into the Harper Connelly series and I find that this one does not grab my attention either. It seems so odd to me that a writer who can pull me in so completely in one of her series could leave me completely uninterested in her other books and stories. I didn't hate this book, it's just not particularly entertaining, and definitely not enthralling.

Okay, so the characters are great.  Very interesting group but the book dragged on and on.  I thought this was terrible.  Once I had read more than half the book, I started skimming over and even then I skipped to the last three chapters.  The ending was good. That's about all I can give of a good review.  This is not a typical Charlaine Harris book.  I was horribly bored.
It is a little bit strange and frankly quite different from the witty Soocky Stackhouse stories. It is intriguing to a certain extent but it is not exactly what I have expected.

Charlaine Harris has written a few different series besides Sookie's, and in this book, she collects characters from all of them. The police officer is from her Aurora Teagarden series, Manfred is from the Harper Connelly series, and Bobo is from the Lily Bard series. All of those series are great, although these minor characters are not necessarily the most compelling. The most interesting part of this new series for me is thinking about how the worlds of all these series overlap. There's nothing supernatural in the Aurora Teagarden OR Lily Bard books, but now suddenly there are vampires, witches and shape-shifters in their world? Well, ok.

This was one of those books that I made myself read.  It took me about halfway through before the characters kind of made sense but still left with a lot of questions.  If you want to read it wait for the paperback, you won't feel like you wasted too much money.

Charlene Harris still has a way of describing places and bringing characters to life was great aplomb. However with that said this book still wasn't hitting me the way the Sookie Stackhouse series did. However my review is not going to be about how great the last series of books she wrote that I enjoyed was and how awful this one is as I wish to give some viewpoints. You do you really get to know on this book is the question I'd like to ask? Who do you really care about? I didn't like anybody enough to want to read the second installment-- if there is one-- to this series. The first book in a series really has to have some punch to keep you interested. It has to find his voice unlike a TV series, fairly early on or you lose interest. This book was just interesting enough to finish but other than that I'm just not that impressed. I am disappointed because Ms. Harris has a lot of potential to write another amazing series.

I love the first 8 or 9 of the Sookie Stackhouse series but thought that the remaining books jumped the shark or sucked the blood if you will. I also love the 'Grave' series. This book though is a snoozer. I have listened to the narrator, Susan Bennett breathe life into my favorite vampire trilogy by Christopher Moore and was totally enthralled; by the stories and the narration. She read this book like she was confused and the whole effort seemed disjointed somehow. The material, which IMO, is totally lackluster didn't help. I believe that ' stick a fork in me, I'm done' describes where I am in regards to Ms. Harris' work. It was fun while it was readable.  On to The Dresden Files....

I didn't really care for this book. I loved the Sookie series & the Grave sight series but this one just wasn't great. Its about an odd bunch of small town residents but its told in the 3rd person which may have been part of the problem. Charlaine is great with first person stories. She's new to 3rd person & her normal southern warmth was missing with the new writing style. The characters weren't very notable either.

Well, I'm not really  a customer, because I got the book at the library.  But,  I really enjoyed it.  The tagline indcated that everyone in town has a secret and you learn about a few of them.  I just felt it was a really good read and I'm looking forward to more in the series.

I'm of mixed mind about this book.  I was happy to find familiar character names popping up as if everyone from Ms. Harris's other books were continuing their lives in their respective towns.  And the interest and suspense kept up pretty well throughout the book.  But unfortunately this book also has the feel of a freshman novel or a slapdash got-to-meet-a-deadline/hodge-podge novel.  I was often unsure of which universe the novel occupied (what kind of magic did the average Joe expect?).  There was a lot of moment by moment character exposition and then, all of a sudden, a sudden twist.  I guess what I'm saying is although the novel was entertaining in the style of what I've come to expect from Ms. Harris, it lacks the writing skill level that I expected.  That's disappointing.

I have liked Ms. Harris' books in the past.  This one just really left me hanging.  It hinted at the supernatural a little but just never quiet got there.  I finished it cuz i started it but other than that,  its not one i would recommend unless you have nothing else to read and are killing some time.  It wasnt bad, it just wasnt that good.  Sorry Charlaine,  just didnt feel this one.

I have read every book Ms Harris has ever written from Teagarden,Connelly,Bard and Stackhouse  and all the anthology's and in betweens and I loved them all...  This is going to have to get a lot better to compete with any of them..  The characters were "ok"  just needs to have more action or umph.. Maybe the next one will be better.

Really people... after the cluster f*ck that CH did with the end of the SVM series, I cannot believe anyone is buying this book. I did, and I should have probably shot myself in the head for doing it. Horrible writing, grammar, etc. Does she even have an editor??? Horrible, just horrible...there is nothing left to say,

Very disappointed by this book.  I have read all of Charlaine Harris's books and this one took me forever to finish.  I could not capture any one character as my favorite and the proof reading really needs some work.
I have read all the Sooky Series and thought this would be an interesting book also.  Wrong.  Very boring and does not keep your attention. Not worth reading.

I bought this book at a used book kiosk for $2 bucks so for the money I spent... $2 bucks was about right. I've read other books by Ms. Harris but only really loved the early Sookie novels. I gave this book three stars because I read it all the way through without skimming any pages, the characters initially had potential and I like cats. No real like able characters which would be okay if the plot was interesting but it moved at such a slow pace. I found myself not caring about the mystery and solved it some time before the  end. Any type of relationships whether romantic, friendship or otherwise wasn't believable.  The few (very few) interesting characters were hardly ever used. If I find the sequel at the same price I'll probably give it another chance or barring that I'll check it out from my library but I won't spend any more money than that or spend any more time anticipating the next Charlainne Harris book.
I've read all of this author's books but found I could not finish this book.
It's okay but not nearly as good as her Sookie Stackhouse novels.

Harris' writing style seems a little "off" in her newest book, which starts off reminiscent of King 's "Needful Things" in weird tone and set up. I couldn't get into her new characters which seem like they should be interesting, but even the gift astrologer came off dull and over detailed. Been happy with most everything else by the author, including all her other series and stand alone, but this didn't do it for me.
I had high hopes.  I should have lowered my expectations
An entertaining read. No one charachter clearly came through as the protagonist. Felt like Ms Harris was laying the groundwork for a second book.

I love most of Harris's books, but this one lacks the attachment to the characters that the others have. I understand that she may be trying to save some of the characters' secrets for other novels, but since she kept changing the POV of the different characters I expected to learn something about them. And then at the end, the BIG REVEAL, has no lead up, no build up, and comes as a disturbing surprise. I will read the next one, this time hoping I can actually connect.
Not well written could have been completed as a novella, but easy to read. Small surprise ending.  Certain there will be more Midnight Crossing books to follow.

I was hoping this new series would take me back to the writing I loved by Charlaine Harris, but that didn't happen. I loved the small town setting and the descriptions of the town were vivid. The characters were ok, but I didn't care much when one was in "danger".  The plot was predictable and dull. I'm an avid reader and it took me along time to finish this book. There was too much fluff and not enough bite to hold my interest. Unless my library has the ebooks available I won't be reading anymore books in this series.
I really did not know what I was reading the whole time.Maybe  the people of Midnight are supposed to be like your own next door neighbors?I just do not know?
Loved Charlaine Harris' True Blood series. This was not as good. Kept my interest but it wasn't nearly as fun to read or as humorous.

It has some interesting plot-twists and surprises within the characters and it does share some of the elements of the Sookie novels (quirky characters in a weird town).  But it is definitely lacking the sparkle of the previous series.  I missed having a POV character to take me through the story unless Manfred or Fiji is intended as the POV.  I found neither character to be very engaging, though.  It did leave some open questions about the other residents of Midnight but perhaps those will be answered in the subsequent novels.
characters were a little flat and the story was not very exciting but it was an easy read. just expected more.
This is a well-written novella. Not a complete book. No resolution. Interesting while it lasts though.  I wish it had been a complete novel.

I didn't love it but it was an enjoyable read. After reading all of her other books the killer is easy to pick out. Some plot points are beyond ridiculous. However,I did enjoy the characters and their interactions.
Not one of Charlaine Harris better works. No intensities, no humor and no excitement. I rate flat, dull and boring.

This book was painfully boring.  I yawned more than that dang talking cat.  I loved sookie and I was looking forward to a new story from Mrs Harris. I keep reading waiting for something exciting to happen. 3/4 of the way through the book and It never did. I Push through until the end. Hugh waste of time!

Well this was certainly no Sookie Stackhouse. I thought it was boring and only finished it because I kept waiting for something good to happen and I don't like not finishing a book. Doubt I'd bother with a sequel.

Enjoyed this book tremendously. A gentle yet powerful change from Sookie, Fiji and the other mysterious residents of Midnight, Texas pull you into town and into their unusual lives. Highly recommended.

The characters could be very interesting if we were ever told anything about them. It's basically one long introduction to the town, with a thoroughly disappointing resolution to the mystery of Aubrey.
I loved Charlaine Harris' writing for the true blood series. Maybe it's because she was introducing new characters, but this book was a big disappointment. It made me wonder if she really wrote it.
This was a change of pace in Charlaine's writing. the story line was good just needed more interesting characters and excitement.
It was an ok book I wasn't to impressed with it, it wasn't really a very good type mystery book to me it just didn't make sense

If you go into this expecting a murder mystery, you're going to be disappointed, despite the dead body that turns up early in the book.  Both the body and the main character exist principally to facilitate the introduction to the odd and secretive community of Midnight.  In fact, had the main character not been in the book at all, very little would have changed in the events that followed- nothing he does makes any real difference to the outcome of events.  That having been said, Harris has previously demonstrated slowly unfolding threads through multiple books, and it was nice to see a couple of minor characters from her Harper Connelly and Shakespeare series coming back as main characters.  And the community of Midnight was sufficiently interesting that I will likely check out the next book.  It would be nice if the next one had an actual plot, however, with an opportunity for the actions of the main characters to affect the outcome.

I had a hard time getting through this book. Infact it seems 3rd times plus jury duty was the charm. The overall plot was decent. I also enjoyed how this tied together the other series. All are now shown to be connected to the true blood world. In those books Jack Leeds made an appearance. Bobo the main character in this book  was from the lily bard series. Also, the sheriff was in the tea garden series and if course Manfred was from the grave series. The only thing that had me connected to the book  was my past love for those series. I just never got sucked in. It was...too many secrets and too many characters with no depth to any if them. I couldn't relate because there wasn't enough of a foothold of this is who they are. I will read the next ones just like I read her others because some I really loved.

The residents of Midnight, Texas, a small town in the middle of nowhere, are mostly loners who keep their secrets to themselves, Although the early part of the story consists of learning that one is a witch, another a psychic, and another a vampire, we won’t be learning more about the others until later in the series.  The plot begins with the discovery of a decomposing body of a woman who has been missing.  It turns out that she has been sent undercover by an extremist militia group.  When the townsfolk find themselves imperiled by the gang, they fight back using their unusual powers. Unlike Harris’ other series, where main characters Harper Connelly and Sookie Stackhouse immediately stand out, this is more of an ensemble weirdness.  The book is a quick-read but, so far, not a must-read.

Overall, I didn't mind this book.  It wasn't exciting, but I didn't find it completely boring either.  I see from other reviewers that at least one of the characters in this book is from one of Ms. Harris' other series.  Having only read the Sookie Stackhouse series of hers, I didn't feel I was missing out on anything by not knowing this before I read the book.  That being said, despite the lack of action, I found the characters to be interesting and fairly well rounded.  The story was kind of slow moving, but it did keep me interested until the end at least, although I wasn't sitting on the edge of my seat while reading it.
LOVE all of her books. Each series of books keeps me riveted the whole time!  Must read!

I love Charlaine Harris and was excited to see a new series from her. Although I was wary, I wasn't disappointed. Full of the quirky and odd characters you're used to, Midnight Crossing is much lighter-hearted than anything of hers I've read before. Fiji and her cat, Mr. Snuggly, are my favorite characters. Fiji is a self-proclaimed witch with a heart of gold. Mr. Snuggly, on the other had, is a cat. 'Nuff said. But he's got tons of attitude and personality. Really cannot wait to read the next installment to see what else the residents of Midnight have to offer.

I am re-reading this book before reading Day Shift. I have read all of Charlaine Harris's books; but I read all of the Sookie books first. It is always difficult to get into an author's new series, and I think many people did not like the writing style of this book. At first I felt it was a little stilted, but then I realized it was because it was from the POV of each character, reflecting the way in which each character thought. This was a subtler book than her others and probably needs to be read (or listened) to twice be appreciated.

I had read about this book several times, once I finally purchased it and started reading, well it has met the expectations that I had with Charlaine Harris. I was a Sookie fan, and I have started also reading about Harper Connelly, and all are great books by a really good author. the suspense is there, with Midnight, you never know what is happening and where it will lead, the characters are interesting, and since this is a series book, I can't wait to see where it goes!

I'm an avid Charlaine Harris reader but I gotta be honest, this was not one of her better books. Sorry to say. This story was actually pretty lame. It took FOREVER to get the story moving along. Very anti-climatic. The only surprise was who dunnit. And even then it was a stretch. I don't think I'm going to finish this series of books. It just didn't do much for me. I love you Charlaine but this book was kind of a stinker.

I liked this novel a lot. More of a supernatural 'whodonit' than anything else - but there are no straight answers until the very end and even then... there are mysteries remaining.  Good set up to a new series.
The story line is pretty good but she really doesn't get to it until the end of the book.  The first 1/2 of the book is spent developing the charicters
Easy read, interesting characters, not a lot of plotline... Ends somewhat abruptly making you look forward to the next book or get annoyed depending on your point of view
I love it.  Cannot wait to find out the others secrets.

The mystery was ok, but a talking cat? And most of the characters have appeared in other Ms. Harris's novels. The culprit was just not believable and a major let down. Especially after the build up. Plus what's up with the shadowy creature lurking around in the middle of the night. I hope Day Shift is better because I love Charlaine Harris and a majority of her books are fabulous...so fingers crossed

I must admit that I was hesitant to read another series by Charlaine Harris but I am so glad I did.  This is a somewhat "simple" read about a very unique small town and its residents.  Each character is one that I grew to love as the story unfolded and I look forward to the next book in this series!  I just hope this series stays true to the original story line and doesn't wander into la la land.

Charlaine Harris did not disappoint!  She surprised me by bringing people from other series into this book.  I liked it!  She writes in such a way that I really can't put the books down.  I try to pace myself but still just eat them up.  Anyone that enjoys ANY of her previous books is sure to LOVE this one too.  Midnight is a great place for strange things to happen.  Keep them coming Charlaine!

I'm such a huge fan of Charlaine Harris' books that I was excited that a new series is here.  I like the incorporation of past characters come together to provide a brand new story.  It was a little slow starting but once the story unfolded it peaked my interest.  Definitely looking forward to the sequel. She's right up there with Stephen King in my opinion.  Hope you enjoy it as much as I did.

This story was like none I have ever read.  It was mildly interesting, but in all honesty, I did not find any of the characters likeable.  The mystery was wrapped up in a very disturbing story twist.  If there is another in the series, I will not be reading it.

different, which  isn't a bad thing, it was one of those books that I picked it up/put it down, repeat. and would have to go to re-read because I forgot what had been happening when I left off then there was that "aha" moment. you can get the gist of the book from the publishers blurb, as I don't care to write a long, detailed book report, nor do I read them. try the sample.

I've ignored children and dogs for the last two days (luckily it's a holiday weekend) to finish the first book in this series. It's been sitting in my wish list for months. WHY DID I WAIT SO LONG?! I'm a Texas girl, and I love that this book is full of what you'd refer to in my small town as "characters"...which is usually a nice way of saying odd. Bless their hearts.

This Book reminds me of a long walk in the country.  You have to take your time or you miss some of the plot twist and zingers. ( Unfortunately, I do not want to say more than that or I may spoil some surprises! )  The story does unfold at its own pace and you can not rush it.  Interesting start to a new mystery series.  I am very intrigued to see what happens next.

I think I've read every novel Charlaine Harris has written over the past few years. I was a little disappointed in the last few True Blood books. I was a little hesitant to try this one. Pleasantly surprised at how some characters from the past had ties in this book, I enjoyed the unexpected laughs from some of these mystical characters. An enjoyable read.

This book held my interest and the story line was fine. The characters need to be better developed.  No particular character stood out.  This is the first Midnight Crossroad book, I think.  So, probably there will be more development in future books.  The Aurora Teagarden and Dead series had characters who caught your attention in the first books.

I enjoy Ms Harris' books, in all her series, but this one is another step away from the Sookie books.  An ensemble of strange characters, like in McCall-Smith's books, are the big payoff in this novel.  Read it for itself, and enjoy.  Go into it expecting something similar to what you've read of hers previously, and you may be disappointed.

I wasn't sure what to expect from Charlaine Harris after the conclusion of the True Blood book series.  I was pleasantly surprised after finishing this book and I'm looking forward to book 2 of this series.  The town of Midnight seems to hold a lot of mystery and secrets and I'm anxious to discover more about it's inhabitants.

Harris is having fun with this book, her characters are fun, different, and a little odd.  Midnight Texas is just what I think a typical little Texas town would be like. There is a murder in town, some offbeat radical group and a confrontation with a witch. The community pulls together to protect themselves. Good story.

This is first of three or more novels which introduces and partly develops the back stories of the main characters. Two thirds is a mild mystery story wrapped in a slight supernatural aura mixed with some right wing nut job characters mainly because this is Texas and somebody has to bring the non-supernatural terror.

This book was not as exciting as the Sookie Stackhouse stories, it was slow to show the story line, I felt it was a little weak, some of the characters were not clearly defined.  And really went nowhere. Left a lot of questions unanswered

I delighted in this book. It is unique in the way that it expresses disturbance, angst, folly, and utter cruely man is capable of. Yet, the conclusion is satisfying, substantive, and will haunt you. The best fiction of the year for me.

I've always liked Charlaine Harris books and revisiting some familiar characters is always fun.  This is like a cross between her detective and supernatural series.  There were twists I didn't expect and I enjoyed being able to get into the book quickly.  Can't wait for the next installment.

Great first book of a new series by Charlaine Harris filled with interesting characters and great plot twists!! The best way to visit small-town Texas!! This was a quick read as it was hard to put down and wondering what was going to happen next! Looking forward to the next one!

Harris has begun another series with a strong protagonist and an eerie plot. I know I have said before that  she has a good touch with character, and she keeps to that traditional  excellence. I enjoy Harris greatly. Hope that the next installment is a satisfying read as well.

This series is very different from the Sookie Stackhouse series. I read the whole thing in a day. It is a interesting little town,this Midnight Texas. I will be looking for the next novel to come out. A must read for all paranormal fans,you will not be disappointed.

No review, but it was an interesting book, and I've pre-ordered the next.  Found another by Charlaine Harris and another author that I just finished and enjoyed a lot.  It was "book 2", I don't remember the name, it was two novellas.  It was well worth it.

It's been awhile since I've read anything by Charlaine Harris. Took awhile to get used to the new characters. Too bad Zelda couldn't have "showed up" in a few sentences. Or Harper. All in all, it was ok. Gotta luv the talking cat!!!!

Great story. Great characters. This is looking to be another great series from Ms. Harris. I have loved every series by her so far and it was fun to see small parts of the older ones here. Cannot wait for the next book.

I like seeing some crossover from Charlaine's other series, but I would have liked some more of Manfred's talent. I do find the assortment of quirky characters interesting, and I'd like to see where she goes with this.

I enjoyed this new series by Charlene Harris.  This first book was primarily an introduction of characters and plot establishment.  I have read the second book in the series and hope for more plot lines in the future.

This is a VERY Different world than True Blood.. Know that going into it! This book was a world building/set up novel. It had an interesting story, but is definitely a great start to a new world for Charlaine Harris.

I have always been an enormous fan of Charlaine Harris long before everyone got on the band wagon and HBO ruined the Sookie Stackhouse series with True Blood.  This new book is very much in the "Charlaine Harris spirit" so if you enjoy her work, you'll probably like the book.  She sticks with her real life tales of supernatural characters set in the back drop of the American south (well, it's Texas but still pretty close to being southern).  I definitely fell in love with the spirit and companionship of Midnight, TX and the unique hodge podge of characters.  The only thing I felt that was lacking with the book was the fact that it didn't start off in the typical way that her other books do where they suck you in and leave you constantly wanting more.  It just felt like a good start to what may become a pretty good series.  I suppose every author has their "Gone With the Wind" where nothing else they do could possibly live up to that one pinnacle of their career.  Perhaps Charlaine Harris has reached her pinnacle with the Sookie Stackhouse series but I hope not.  I will definitely read more of the books in this series as she releases them and hope they continue to get better but, man, I sure miss Sookie.

The characters don't jump off the page, the setting isn't convincing, and the plot feels forced. I absolutely loved all the Stackhouse books, so I'll try Harris's next series even if I give this one a pass.

I've read everything Charlaine Harris has ever written, I think. This book is slower-paced than the Sookie Stackhouse series. It feels more like the Harper Connolly or Lily Bard series--somewhat melancholy, with relaxed pacing. The protagonists seem like real individuals, and I look forward to learning more about them. The white supremacists are more cartoon-like, though there is an interesting brief scene when you meet the parents of one of them. Another individual seems very like a character in _An Ice Cold Grave_. Harris slips in references to every other series she has written, even the Aurora Teagarden series, so fans will enjoy that.

Midnight Crossroad is like meeting someone for the first time yet feeling as if you've known them forever. Charlaine has again created a world with original characters that you just can't get enough of.
As always Charlaine's stories are very good but I was shockingly expecting for the book to continue when u got this "review this book". It will be quite interesting what new tales the book 2 brings.
I loved this light fantasy about lovely, strange folk that make the world larger and more interesting. It is easy, relaxing reading with a touch of excitement. I'm speaking as a witch of course.
What a fun, excellent read! Charlaine Harris always delivers. I love these characters and I love this town. Mr. Snuggles--come live with me!
Quick read.  Reminds you of the Sookie Stackhouse series but is still different enough to hold your interest.  I was glad to find another Charlaine Harris series.  Looking forward to book 2.
Another great start to an awesome series by C.Harris . Definitely wasn't expecting that kind of plot or twist but was very happy with the turnout of the novel. Can't wait for the next book.
I liked most of the characters and would have liked some back stories on them.  Overall the story was kind of boring and choppy.  Hopefully the next installment will be a better story line.
A real winner. You gotta love the residents of  Midnight.  Everyone different in their own way.  It they take care of each other.  Excellent read.  Once you start it you can't put it down.
There were too many points of view in the story.  I have read other novels with multiple point of view, but this one was so disorganized that it brought you out of the story as you read.
I enjoyed the book and will look forward to the next installment.  The characters were interesting and different but not as well developed as some of the characters in her other books.
Not as good as expected but I think a lot was to do with establishing characters. I expect that the next book will be awesome now that we know who everyone is. Still enjoyable though.
I always enjoy Charlaine Harris, and this doesn't disappoint. A fun new group of folks to hopefully follow around for a few books, and the end was a twist I never saw coming.
.... but started to pick up a third of the way through. Glad I did continue to read. Fell in love with the characters and am interested in learning more about their stories.
I enjoyed this starter to a new series.  I thought it was clever to put character from past series together in one place. Can't wait to see what happens next in Midnight.
I so enjoy ensemble character storylines and am really enjoying this new series by Harris. Each  character line seems full of opportunities within opportunities.
The town of Midnight is my new favorite place to live. I loved this book. So different from Sookie's world, but just as mesmerizing. Can't wait for the next one.
Great start to what I hope is a long series.  Just enough hints of other series (Sookie and the Dead finders) to be familiar but wonderfully new and inventive).
I've read worse books, but this was not up to the usual standards of Charlaine Harris.  Not enough character development and too much skipping around.
This book started out slow but once I got into the book it was wonderful!  So many ups and downs and interesting people. I really enjoyed the book !
Things ain't exactly what they seem to be in the small town of midnight Texas. Everyone has a secret, specialty, or a charm that just isn't natural.
Great read. I really enjoyed the characters. I hope there are more books based in Midnight. I want to find out more about each of the residents.
Pleasant, easy read. Good tension, well developed characters, perfect location for these characters. Waiting to read the next installment.
I had read all the Sookie series and missed them..  But this was a fun, interesting story and I cannot wait until the next one comes out.
I truly enjoyed this book and I'm excited to see how Charlaine Harris will develop these new characters. Can't wait for the next one!

After reading the other reviews I realized that this book is much more fun for people who have read the Teagarden & Harper & Bard series.  Having characters from previous series meet by accident in this little hidden town is great because in their back stories lie the reasons they would choose this place.  This structure makes me even more anxious to find out about the characters I don't recognize.  Thanks Charlaine, I can't wait for the next one.

I'm not a big fan of this authors more popular series but I found that I really enjoyed this book.  The story is good and fast paced.  There isn't a whole lot of supernatural/paranormal to it, but there's just enough to satisfy the genre.  Perhaps the part the I like the most though was characters.  All of the characters were vibrant and seemed to jump off the page, and maybe more importantly they all had something wrong with them.  Flaws both big and small.  It is refreshing to read about characters that are easier to identify with than the perfect little girls or god like vampires that seem to pervade a lot of other books.  I really enjoyed this book and I can't wait for the next one in the series.
Great characters. compelling tale. Want more. I was saddened at where the story took us but I like that no one was untouched.
This is the sort of mystery that I love! I wish there was a bit more psychic stuff in it and it would have been 5 full stars.
Tried to make it last. Couldn't put it down. It was cool the way she worked character from her other series into the new one.
Great character development in this quick & easy read. Can't wait to find out more secrets of Midnight.  Screenplay, anyone?
love charlaine harris; her writing makes you feel like you're hearing the story from a friend; love her quirky characters
I like the kookie characters and the off beat town. Not as captivating as the Sookie Stackhouse series but I enjoyed it.
Interesting characters. But not the same depth as True Blood. I am looking forward to the next one in the series though.
I like her as an author, but I just couldn't get into this book.  Will still buy her books though, just not this series.
It's just slightly off. The names don't feel right with the description of the characters. Kinda all over the place too
Okay read. Not as well organized as the Stackhouse series. Maybe the characters will gain more depth in the next novel.
The characters in the mini town are great. They are like a family. I look forward to book number two of the trilogy.
This book was an easy read and an interesting departure for Ms. Harris.  It isn't laugh out loud fun, but it is fun.
This is a nice easy read.  Not great literature but entertaining and fun.  I enjoyed getting to know the characters
The POV changed randomly which meant the storyline got tangled and I just couldn't care how things turned out.  I saw a lot of potential in the premise, but it was very poorly written.
Love Charlaine Harris, we're happy to see Manfred again. That is all type type type type type type type thanks
Great story! I loved how the characters interwove with her other books! Just ordered the second in the series!
A little slow moving but with some very interesting characters who's develop I am looking forward to following
I'm not able to get into any characters in this book.  I'm not sure I will finish it.  The story is dragging.
It  kept my interest and I look forward to the next book in what  I hope ongoing series like her Sookie books
Definitely not Sookie and her friends. Still interesting tho. I will read the next one and see what I think

I have a bone to pick with Ms. Harris!  As a Conservative, as well as a fan of her Sookie Stackhouse books, I was DISGUSTED to see her equate white supremacy with Conservatism!  It is an untrue and "progressive" distortion of the truth.  It would be like Ms. Harris being compared to a "Stalinist" communist because she has liberal views!  Enough already!!

This is the first book of a new series by Charlaine Harris.  Most of the story line was setting up the characters. And, they are the most interesting characters! Charlaine Harris always gives a good story no matter what series she is writing and this was no different. One is drawn into the setting and the characters ' lives. The plot revolves around a murder that has occurred.  It is nicely written and holds the interest. I cannot wait til the second book in the series comes out. I like the characters as they all have such diverse personalities.
My favorite is the cat.  Can't wait for the next one. My favorite is the cat.  Can't wait for the next
I enjoyed the new (and old) characters from her other books, but I thought she could have done better.
I love the series but this book is after the fact. Even for short stories it didn't flow well for me.
Really isn't worth the time to write much of a review.  It isn't horrible but it was far from great

Unlike many reviews I've read, I quite liked the characters. They were quirky and interesting. I could picture them in future books. I've read Harris' Sookie Stackhouse and Aurora Teagarden books and I just enjoy her writing style. The one thing that kept irritating me as I read the book was how I kept being hit over the head with Harris' political views. I've noticed it in her other books but was able to just kind of ignore the preaching and enjoy the reality escape. With this one I got tired of mentally rolling my eyes.
Not what I thought it would be.  Thought it would be more like the Grave books.  Still enjoyable.

Have read all of Ms. Harris' series, because her characters are so vibrant and fun it's a pleasure to hop into their world and go along for the ride.. Hoping this book is the start of her next series. We're teased with tiny glimpses of fascinating back stories and left wanting to know so much more about each player. 4 stars vs 5 is due to the frustration of knowing there's so much more to learn about all these folks, with no hint that our curiosity will be satisfied. Please give us more of Midnight, Charlaine!
I thought this book was a bit hard to get into but once I did I had a hard time putting it don!

I,'ve enjoyed many Charlaine  Harris books on the past and looked forward to reading this first book in a new series.  Unfortunately this read like an author's first novel, drug on with not much happening in the first half other than descriptions of the town and character introductions and I had to force myself to keep reading.
I hope Harris writes more for this series. Great mystery with wonderful, colorful characters

I love Charlaine Harris books, but I found this a little hard to get into.  The new & old characters are very interesting though & it will be good to see what happens next.  The book certainly improved as it went on and I'm sure the next two will be even better.  I will know doubt be sorry when this series ends.

It's a good solid book.  She spends a lot of the book slowly building the characters, making readers watch and wait to get our questions answered.  I have enjoyed almost all of her books ( the last couple of Sookie books were only 3 star) but my special favorites are the Aurora Teagarden ones.  I am looking forward to this series, but I worry that Ms. Harris is getting closer and closer to the dark side.  I am a cosy mystery reader, and like warm happy endings.
Good opening series book, characters are not as developed yet - looks promising though.
I really liked this oddball book and am looking forward to the next in the series!
Really liked it.  The initial book in a series that I am anxious to read more of.
This book was interesting enough to keep you reading, waiting for the next event.
Ok addition to Harris's bibliography. Not gripping, but amusing, passable read.
Another great series by C. Harris. I look forward to the rest in the series.
Great return to mystery writing!  Loved the connections to her other series!

There was a lot of character development through the majority of the book.  She delves into another world within our world and that makes this entertaining.  I liked the characters and look forward to learning more about them in the next book.  For those that are so critical about this new book, I can only say, "It is fiction"!  If you want bleeding heart reality, turn on the news.
the same lovely  writing and  querky  characters we have come to expect.
I can't believe the same writer did Sookie.  This one was kinda boring.

I love Charlaine's body of work - she is a truly talented writer.  I did find this book took a while to get into - the exposition of so many characters at the start was cumbersome to navigate but once the story found it's rhythm and complications where established, it became another great read.  I will definitely be buying the next installment of the series.

I loved the Sookie Stackhouse series but I didn't want a repeat of that series. The introduction of the characters is slow however the story does start evolving with the characters about half way through the book. I will be I interested in the next book...
The book was just what I needed, light reading while on vacation. It was fun how she brought two characters from different series into the story.
although i enjoyed the book , it wasn't as enthralling as id hoped for. still a good enough read and i will read the rest of the trilogy

Loved it! A fun quick read with likable, enjoyable characters. I'm a fan of C. Harris's writing style, the ease of the supernatural merged with reality. Love the idea of a paranormal, mysterious town with a old 24 hour pawn shop and a vampire in the basement, plus a witch down the street and... Well, you get the idea. Can't wait for the next one!
Really liked this book.  I'm ready for the next one in this series!
I still love Harper the best but this is not a bad spin-off series
Humorous, fun, intriguing, and made me want to read the next book.
Is especially good if you've read the dead series.Fun characters.
This book was a good quick and easy read. Entertaining and funny.
Great beginning to what I hope will be a series to equal Sookie.
I loved this book, I hope she writes more with these characters.
Hopefully there will be another in the Midnight, Texas series.
It's ok but didn't hook me like the Southern Vampire Series
I was expecting more from her.  But did enjoy the book.
i loved it and am looking forward to the next book.

I know some people were disappointed in this new story, but I don't see why.  Good plotting, good development, and a town full of people whose secrets will fuel several more books.  I enjoyed seeing 3 characters from her other series.
Wonderful author - riveting book. Loved it.

Interesting and fun characters with secrets that lock you into the story and their lives.  Very entertaining and addictive.  If you loved Sookie you will love this new series.  I can't wait for the next book!

I never felt like the ending of the Harper Connelly series did justice to Manfred Bernardo's character, and so I was thrilled that he would be in this new series.  There is a murder mystery in this book, but it felt like that story line was meant to reinforce the larger mystery that is Midnight, Texas.  There is not a lot of action, especially in the beginning, and the reveals are slow but very clever, and the way Charlaine Harris brings out the secret details of Midnight's residents is extremely pleasurable.  At the same time, my major complaint is that the book is slow, and the murder mystery was not so much at the top of my list of concerns.  I was more interested in the residents and their interactions with each other.  I was also disappointed that Manfred came across as a bit of a charlatan and didn't exhibit any of the psychic prowess that I know he is capable of.  However, I am still in love with his character and will be back for the next book.
it was different but I enjoyed the book
Always enjoy reading Charlaine Harris!
I can't believe that I actually liked it. After doing a disgusting last three books in the Sookie Stackhouse series to say my expectations were low is an understatement.
Hope she writes more on this town!
I love Charlaine Harris books.  This one was a nice change from some of her other ones, but still a good read.  I'm looking forward to reading more in this series.
When does the next book come out?
absolutely up there with Sookie!
Good read. Nice to have something out by this author. I hope that there are as many in this serried as there were in the Sookie Stachouse saga.
Hope she writes more of these.
The characters are well thought out and developed. The plot moves along really well. Very enjoyable read from one of my favorite authors.
It is an interesting book since I have read many of her previous series and was already familiar with a couple of the main characters.
Can't wait for the next one!
I love how Charlaine Harris has taken characters from other series to create a new one. The denizens of Midnight are intriguing!
cant wait for the next one!
Love that characters from her other books were mentioned. Well written, great story, i can't wait for more. Keep them coming.
great story, want more!
I can't wait to read the next book. So far I haven't read a book by Charlaine Harris that I didn't like.
Interesting characters, unique plot.  Keeps you interested from start to finish.  Great leisure reading
Just loved the fascinating group of characters created in this book.  Hope to see more of them.

Midnight Crossroad is my current favorite book.  I finished it last night and I’m still thinking about Midnight, Texas.  I loved everything about it!  This is the first novel in a new series by Charlaine Harris.  The plot starts out a bit slow, but her writing is so interesting that it doesn’t matter and it’s because she is introducing us to an amazing cast of characters.  I loved learning about Midnight, Texas and its secretive inhabitants.  My favorite character is Mr. Snuggly, all of my LOL moments involved the cat (and I did actually laugh out loud several times).  And I had no idea “who done it” until it was revealed, the whole ending was perfect!  If you haven’t read it yet go and get it now!  If you only buy one book this month make it Midnight Crossroad!  I didn’t regret it and you won’t either!
Ms Harris writes well, and I enjoyed her novel that breaks away from the Sookie mold.
A good, easy read.
Super.  Great to have a new group of characters that only Charlaine can create!
Very much like a Scooby Doo episode, "those pesky kids" kind of thing.
I love Ms. Harris and this little gem of a book was a fun distraction for me. I miss the Sookie universe, but travelling to Midnight made for a nice little holiday.
It took me a while to really begin to like the characters but found myself immersed in Midnight,Texas without me even knowing it.  Another great book from Charlaine Harris.
if your looking for some Pulitzer Prize winning novel, this is not it. But if you want an interesting, easy read, get this. I enjoyed it, finished it in two sittings.  I recommend it for sure.
I have ALL of Charlaine Harris' books, and this one is one of her BEST YET!!!

I love novel based in Texas (being a Texas girl) so I purchased this book. Normally I love Harris' novel, but the writing has been off a little for years. I am just disappointed in the overall depth of the characters I never feel like I got to know any of them well enough to care about them. Msybe things will be made clearer in the next novel.

I really enjoyed this book! It was great reading about characters from all the other Harris universes such as Bobo from the Shakespeare novels and Arthur from the Teagarden novels. I've read all of Harris' works, so it was a treat to read a book where all these characters intercepted at the crossroads of a little town called Midnight. The mystery was well constructed, as usual, and left me guessing until the end. The characters were mysterious and amusing and the story well-written. Good to see Harris getting back to top form after the conclusion of the Sookie novels.

I really enjoy reading Charlaine Harris.  The quirky world her characters inhabit are just full of interesting things-this author has a way about her, that's for sure, and once introduced to her books, you want more!  The population of Midnight, Texas does not disappoint.  I don't want to spoil the read for anyone by giving away ANYTHING.  Let's just say if you are a Sookie Stackhouse fan, or a Harper Connelly fan you will be a Midnight Crossroad fan too. An introduction to what could be a great series, I patiently wait for more-you will too!
Great series!
Hope there more stories about this group of people,
Great book! Loved hearing from familiar characters

I'm happy to have a new series from Charlaine Harris and it feels like it will be another good one if she keeps going with these characters. We get to meet some old friends from previous books and the new characters are intriguing enough to make me want to read more. Midnight Texas is the perfect setting for the quirky world Charlaine has created and I thoroughly enjoyed this book! The sad part is how long I'll have to wait for another one.

Loved this book. The first chapter or two was a little slow but after that I could not put it down. I can't wait for the next one to come out. My favorite character in the book was Fiji and her cat. I would still like to learn more about the rest of the crew and the mysterious trips that Olivia took plus what is in the old books that Lemuel was looking for. Midnight, texas sounds like a town I would like to visit.
Was a great read.  Having read all the Snookie True Blood books, I wondered if Charlaine could repeat that success.  I now know she did, maybe surpassing it.  Am looking forward to the next book.
It took me a sec but I then realized some familiar faces!  Couldn't put the book down! Don't want to wait for the next installment! !! Excited to see what is next for the inhabitants of Midnight!

I love you Charlaine Harris!!!!!  My favorite books of yours are the Lily Bard - Shakespeare series.  It took me a minute to realize where Bobo came from.  The Lily Bard series is my favorite of any of your series.  It's great to see him back again, I can't wait to read the next book.  Course a visit to Shakespeare wouldn't hurt.  Thanks so much for the hours of enjoyment!!!! You rock~!!!  Cathy T

I was so pleased to have found Bernard again! He was such a great character in Ms. Harris' Harper Connelly Series.  And then I found Bobo also in Residence at Midnight, TX! He's from the Lily Bard Mysteries set in Shakespeare, Arkansas. The other characters were interesting and "real". I honestly liked the book and would certainly like to read more about that interesting community.

I AM WAITING EAGERLY FOR MORE BOOKS IN THIS SERIES.  I REALLY LIKE THE MAIN CHARACTER, AND REMEMBER HIM FONDLY FROM THE HARPER CONNELLY SERIES OF BOOKS.  THIS IS A FAST READ, AND KEEPS YOUR ATTENTION TO THE END.  LOTS OF INTERESTING PEOPLE, WITH SOME NONHUMANS THROWN IN THERE, TOO.  REALLY GOOD, HOPE SHE KEEPS THIS SERIES GOING AT LEAST AS LONG AS THE SOOKIE BOOKS!!

I loved this book.  I thought the characters were great. I thought it was a little hard to read but that didn't stop me and I found it was a great read. I read the Harper Connolly series and loved that as well.  I am not much on the other books but who knows.  I may try again and like them.  I cannot wait until the second book in the Midnight Texas books come out.
Promising new beginning of a series.  Apparently will be built around a side character from one of her other series.  Watch the series.  I think it will be great.
Very good book loved it. . A must read

I stumbled across this book while looking for another author and bought on a whim. The quirky blend of magic, mystery, and relationships was intriguing enough entice me to buy it. Subsequently, I have purchased most of her other books. Ms. Harris is a wonderful storyteller of magical, contemporary fiction. Thoroughly enjoyed Midnight Crossroad!
nice read

Written by Charlaine Harris (love all her stories/books).  I loved the "new" supernatural characters in it and that it was a mystery story (no spoilers).  Hard to write anything else outside of it was hard to put down...love her writing style.  Wonder if she will be writing a follow-up...new mystery with these characters.

I'm a huge fan of the Sookie Stackhouse books. I started to gobble them up years ago like they were crack and I was an addict. So I was super excited to learn Charlaine Harris was coming out with a new series: Midnight, Texas. Midnight Crossroad is the first book in this series, and it didn't start off with a bang.
Loved it
I thought it would be written in the style of her other books in which Manfred appeared. It was ok but a little unbelievable even for her.

I enjoyed this book on it's own and am looking forward to more in this series. The characters were interesting and the plot was full of twists. It heals my attention and kept me engaged. I have read most of this author's other books and enjoyed the little hints of them throughout.

Another great book from one of my favorite authors.  Charlaine Harris is just about the only author that I'd buy without reading anything from the book before hand.  She is really great and I've read all her books.  Now I just sit around waiting for her to write another one.

I won't say this is the BEST book I ever read, but I enjoyed it the way I liked the Sookie books. I felt like I had taken a really interesting vacation after I had read it, was sad when I finished it and want to read the next one. It did start slow. After the intro, I thought "hmmmm", but then it started rolling. No need to discuss plot because others have done that and why ruin the book... just let it unroll and go with it. If you like Charlaine Harris books, you'll like this one. ---Mrs Mark Sheron
Great book. Fast transaction.

Me gustó. Me sorprendió el final. Nada parecido a lo que había leído de C. Harris, aunque al principio me pareció extraño que se desarrollará desde distintos puntos de vista según el personaje que protagoniza el capítulo, el ritmo es bueno y la historia me atrapó.

I have read all of Charlaine's books!  This was a very fun and colorful story can't wait to read the next book.  What I really liked was she put characters from her other books into this series so clever!  Keep them coming, I can't get enough of her stories.

At first, I didn't think much of this story and several times I nearly tossed the book.  However, I stuck with it and by chapter six I couldn't put it down.  Weird town, weirder characters and attention-holding story.  Can't wait to get the next volume.

This was a fun read, but I have considered each one of Charlaine Harris' series to have something interesting to offer.  I did have a bit of a problem with the perceived sound of one of the voices of a character, but I'm not an expert on familiars.

This book was a very interesting combination of Charlaine Harris horror and Charlaine Harris mystery. I enjoyed getting to know Manfred and the other residents of Midnight, and look forward to a deeper delve into their dark world in the future.

Another great read from Ms. Harris.  I really like the references to characters from her other books.  I like these characters, the setting, the other,everything.  Ms. Harris does not disappoint.  I hope there will be moreover set in Midnight.
I wasn't sure about a new series but it was very good.. Eager to learn more about the people of Midnight.

I have missed reading new material from Charlaine Harris.  This is a great start to a new adventure.  At the end of the book there is a bit of mystery left for each character.  I'm looking forward to the next book.

I was really shocked to see so many negative reviews!!! I just finished this book and absolutely loved it! It seems to me a lot of people are upset that this isn't a Sookie Stackhouse novel and they really need to get over it. An author's work should never be judged by their previous works. Each creation is different. That being said, even I admit that I was saddened by the end of the Sookie Stackhouse novels and I was unsure if I would like this new series as much. All I can say is that I found the characters endearing and the storyline quite enjoyable! The writing is the same quirky style and there were a few twists that I didn't see coming that had me giggling with delight. I could hardly put this book down! I want to read the next one in the series ASAP! I'm looking forward to the rest of the series and I admit that after this book I'm a bit sad to learn that it will only be a trilogy. I think Midnight Texas is just as exciting as Bon Temps Louisiana!

Midnight crossroad is a delightful,enent filled new town of the imagination. . She shapes a town so you can see it and believe that it is somewhere you could pass thru! I can't wait to see what happens next.

This is the best book I have read in years. I always loved the Harper books and the people in them. To find this had Manfred in it was great.  I know some people were unhappy to see the end of Sookies series but it had ran its course.  I hope Mrs Harris writes more books about Midnight. This could be the best of all her series .

I love how a character was pulled from a previous serious and the world of sookie mashed into this book. It's amazing how one serious crossed with another and I cannot wait to get a hold of the next book
gift.
What?
Better than expected.  I enjoyed the characters and the way they are intertwined to develop the story.  The ending seemed kind of rushed, though and didn't fit with the story as much.
I think as the characters evolve in the coming books this series will be really good. I love the easy going writing. I have to say my favorite characters are the cat and the reverend.
Charlaine Harris creates massively interesting characters. I'm not sure how this will compare to Bon Temps, but I'm willing to go along for the ride and am waiting for the next book.
I rated this average for the quality of the narration, simple sentence structure and vocabulary.  Entertaining storyline.  Would recommend as good read for teens or advanced preteen.
New series with some familiar characters starts well!  Nicely constructed- I didn't know "whodunit" til the end.  Next installment 5 months away- write faster!
Such a great book! I'm excited about this new series and love that Ms. Harris has integrated so many characters from her previous series. Can't wait for the next one!
I love Charlaine Harris and this book did not disappoint. I would say the only thing about this book was it took awhile to get to the plot. Once there it was awesome.
I loved this new series. I always appreciate how Charlaine Harris develops her characters...and this is no exception. I can't wait for the next one in the series!
Loved it! Took me a few minutes to "place" some of the characters (who had been in her previous books). It was nice to see Bobo and Manfred again :)
Welcome to Midnight Texas! Love love love all these new and highly interesting characters and the twists and turns  this story takes. Definitely recommend!
Loved this fun, fresh novel! I had always hoped to hear more about Manfred since the Harper Connelly series, and I was delighted to see him in this book.
I like Bon Temps, LA better, but Midnight, TX has potential
Overall a cute story. However, I didn't care for the ending, and the details really dragged on so you thought there was something further.
OK.  Quick read. Didn't quite capture me like the Sookie books, but certainly an acceptable mystery and a good start to a new series.
I have read most of Charlaine's books & this one was a little light on mystery, suspense and drama. But if was a good summer read.
It took at least half of the book to get into it. I never did figure out if I liked it enough to buy another if it is a series.
Excellent.  Could sense the authors style as I got into the book.  Would make a good film I reckon as good characters in it.
