That was the best storybook I've read since her "Harper" books. I'm so happy Manfred got a series. Ready for the next one.
Great small town .murder mystery! Charlaine Harris did it again! I have read all of her books and once again she delivers!
Enjoyable, with just enough weirdness to keep you reading.  I liked the characters, and look forward to the next book.

I really enjoyed this book and was amused at how many of the characters I knew from other Charlaine Harris series.  Manfred is from the Grave series, Bobo is from the Shakespeare series, and Arthur Smith is from the Aurora Teagarden series.  I'm sure there are others.  I started reading the book and found it a little slow until I realized that I already knew some of these characters.  I started reading it again and really enjoyed it.
I guess my  had expectations were higher because I loved True Blood. It is worth the read anyway.  Check it out.

I first discovered Charlaine Harris only after True Blood came out on TV.  I read her Sookie novels and decided I liked her writing, so I checked out her mysteries and liked those too.  I expected this book to be more like her previous mysteries, but (no spoilers) it went in a different direction altogether, which I also greatly enjoyed.  I'm looking forward to the next two novels which are projected for this series!
I really enjoyed the start of this new series by Ms. Harris and I eagerly await the release of the next book.
I loved her Sookie series, This was a good read, but I was not wrapped up in the characters, still an ok read
Characters were well defined and just plain fun and then sad and the glad and then mysterious a great read
Loved the quirky characters and even quirkier town.  I can't wait to read the next book in this series.
I enjoyed this book. It was worth the read. I'm ready for the next book in this series. C.H. Write on

book is very strange.  Not much plot.  A good development of interesting characters but the story is lackluster.  It lacks imagination.  The story never seems to b going anywhere.  It never shows a natural progression.  I couldn't tell an still can't what genre it is.  Not a mystery, or drama or comedy or anything.  Definitely goes into the fiction cetegory of just strange.
I loved this book. I liked how she brought in characters from other books to tell a great new story.
Charlaine Harris has done it again, she created a world that is interesting with great characters that I loved.  Cant wait for the next book.
It was OK.
Charlene Harris has done it again.  A fun read.  Each character could be someone that you know.  (Maybe you do)  I look forward to more Midnight TX books.

Ms. Harris writes like a dream. She makes her charming characters and plots seem so easy she's a joy to read. Her novels are like a souffle made with blood and guts beautifully served by a Southern Belle. You find yourself deeply involved in her worlds and characters even if they are so light they hover off the page and are quickly forgotten. This first book in a new series shows great promise. It goes a long way to help the grief in the end of the Sookie Stackhouse books by offering us new characters and places to love. Ms. Harris consistently delivers the goods for escapism and light reading. Book two in this series, now that everything is established should be even more fun and is eagerly anticipated. I'll follow Ms. Harris wherever she wants to take me.
Wonderful book, love all Charlaine Harris books.. Read all of the sookie stack house books. Plan on reading many more od her books

Midnight Crossroad had me Crossed! I loved Manfred Bernardo in the Harper Connelly books but, this story could have been told without Manfred. Short of his moving in and answering email, he did not add to this story at all, the people in the town of Midnight was the story by themselves. This is not Mrs. Harris best work at making the leading character the focus of merging in for the new storyline. The story was exciting and I enjoy it but, Manfred was not a big part of that  excitement.  I only hope Manfred Bernardo shine more in the next two books because he has a lot to show us if his intro from the Harper Connelly books are true to the hint of his talent at reading of minds.
This is an interesting start to what is supposed to be trilogy.  Great character plots and love the style of writing.  Can't wait for the next one!
I'm am glad for new series. this book leaves waiting more about Midnight. Just what is the preacher? I plan to follow the series to find out just what is it about him that makes him so creepy.
Oh! I am so happy that Charlaine Harris has started this new series!  I fell in love with the characters immediately and can't wait to see them develop in future books!

Thank God Charlaine Harris has finally ended the long sad nightmare that the Sookie Stackhouse series became.  I loved those first (fifteen?  whatever) books but it was time to end that bad boy.  And what a way to rebound.  I was almost afraid to read Midnight Crossroad but Ms. Harris delivered, with promises for the future.  Its still her funky paranormal, lightening seared universe with a twist and boy I didn't see this twist coming.  Good mystery that could have happened in any universe, but I am happy that it happened in a Charlaine Harris universe.

Like all of Charlaine Harris' books, Midnight Crossroad is a gripping story following Manfred Bernardo, a psychic who appeared in the Harper Connolly books and who also knew Lily Bard. Lily made an appearance at Merlottes bar and met Sookie Stackhouse...and now we know we are in the Sookieverse! Midnight is a tiny Texas town where the inhabitants are very different and everyone has secrets. Manfred begins to make the acquaintance of his neighbors. Backgrounds are gradually revealed as Manfred becomes part of the community. I sincerely hope that there are more Midnight books to follow. I have unanswered questions about some of the inhabitants and I want to know more about Manfred!
I liked the characters in this book. There were some plot twists that were surprising and I liked that too. I look forward to the next book in the series.
I always enjoy Charlaine's books because of the character development and the way you learn about the characters as the story unfolds.  Easy, quick read.

Harris is simply a good 'mystery story teller' and I love her characters.  I really enjoyed getting to know her new cast of characters and look forward to the rest of the series.  Warning to True Blood ie Sookie Stackhouse & "Eric/Bill" fans - not seeing any great romance or sex on the horizon with this series - just a damn fine story.
Lots of new quirky characters solving a new mystery. I hope we get another story of the 'sorta normal-supernatural' characters of Midnight TX.  This is a fun read.

I did not read any of the "Sookie Stackhouse" books.  I do love True Blood on HBO.  I decided to try this on a whim and turned out I enjoyed it.  The characters are fun and the setting seems unusual enough.  I'd recommend it.

I really enjoyed this book.  As someone who has read all of Charlaine Harris's previous books it was so nice to revisit characters from her former series.  I think that the characters were well developed and interesting.  I am looking forward to reading future stories set in Midnight, Texas.
It doesn't have the same level of craftsmanship as, say, the Harper Connelly series, but it's definitely a good summer's read.

It seems Harris has begun another "Sookie Stackhouse" genre (only a male is the central person), but without the character development - perhaps in the next book there will be more substance as to who these people are that live in Midnight, Texas.  Strange muddle of happenings . . . without knowing who the characters are or their place in this community.  The book left me feeling like I had been plunked down in the middle of weird.  Still not sure I'd like to revisit it.
Interesting book, somewhat creepy, but on the good side. A fascinating cast of characters, and I'm intrigued enough to want to know what will happen next in Midnught, Texas.

Nobody does quirky mystery quite like Charlaine Harris.  Midnight Crossroad introduces you to the residents of Midnight, Texas including psychic Manfred Bernardo (who we met in the Harper Connelly books).  Everybody seems to have their secrets and don’t push to know yours. There are more mysteries than just the town folk and Ms. Harris will have you staying up late to get to the find the answers.

Midnight, Texas, is an intriguing place, and it seems to attract intriguing inhabitants.  There are a lot of mysteries here, although the citizens are polite about not prying into one another's business.  Still, hidden things have a way of creeping into the light.  Charlaine Harris has created a town full of interesting characters and given them interesting puzzles to deal with.  I feel I should mention that the story is not told in the first-person point of view used in many of her other books, and this may startle some fans, but I think the varied points of view used here suit this story better.  There will be at least two more stories set in Midnight, and I, for one, look forward to them.

I was so involved with Sookie Stackhouse that when Charlaine announced that she was ending the series, I was very sad.  I read the new Midnight Crossroad and can see lots of possibilities for a series just as long as the "True Blood" series went.  but I didn't give this book 5 stars because I didn't find anyone in it who I liked as much as I liked Sookie....  But I'm not giving up, I'm sure it will just take time and another book or two for me to love these folks as much as I did the gang in the woods of Louisiana.
I really enjoyed this book. It had familiar faces that had links to Harper and Lily bard. Give it a try

Midnight Crossroad is a fun novel.  Even the name is a twist on what to expect.  At the crossroads, Charlaine Harris is bringing together some great characters from multiple series of books and having them meet new characters who are interesting and special in their own right.  I enjoy how the dialog is more mystery oriented and everything is not given away right away how I sometimes felt the Sookie Stackhouse character did.  Again it is a fun read and very entertaining.  Also it is endearing to those who like to find "Easter Eggs" within the text though it in no way would exclude anyone who is picking this up as their first Charlaine Harris book.
I have recently discovered all the other characters that this author has created..I love them all. A good, sit down and relax book.
All the characters are quirky and fun! Can't wait for the next book! Hurry Charlaine! I can't wait for you to write another book!!

Another great series from Charlain Harris. I loved how she brought together some characters from her other series. She does mystery and the supernatural so well. This book should definitely be on your buy list!
Harris delivers with a quirky, lighthearted, but suitably creepy tale centered around a small town and it's oddball inhabitants.  I thoroughly enjoyed this story.
The first in a trilogy.  Nice setting and good characters.  Would wish for a little more complicated plot.  Will read the sequel when it comes out.

The first book in the Midnight, Texas series does a good job of establishing the key characters and setting. A familiar character or three (one key to this new set of books) connect this with several of Harris' other series. But not -- at least directly that I see -- with Sookie Stackhouse although clearly the universes overlap with some of the same types of "supes". The story itself is more of a mystery cozy with supernatural characters and quirky settings. I actually thought it deserved three-stars as a standalone book; I added the fourth star in anticipation of where the story could go in the future. Let's hope we see these future (short stories, novellas, and books) frequently over the next couple of years. I don't see keeping up with this over a decade+ as with the Southern Vampire series. Bottom line: give it a chance, don't set your expectation too high, and use the time until the next book to chase down Ms Harris's earlier, non-Sookie works to see how this fits in with other stories.

I am a big fan of Ms Harris and all her books. Sookie Stackhouse is not the only character that Harris got me invested in. I am so glad that her newest series will bring fresh blood to the pages of her novels. This book has a light feel but very interesting characters, living together and creating a community of strange. I will be traveling to Midnight Texas again, as soon as the next book is published.
I loved this story! If you are a Charlaine Harris fan,I don't think you will be disappointed!
I really enjoyed this book. Great writing. I will be buying more Charlaine Harris book.
Charlie does not disappoint in this spinoff series.  I can hardly wait for next book.
Great new series.  I'm really looking forward to the next one in the series.  A++
I adore this book and I can't wait for the next in this series!! Good read :)

Charlaine Harris has done it again; can't wait for the next installment.  I got a little frustrated with Sookie Stackhouse as time went on and stopped reading those, but this one is a keeper.  Won't spoil anything for anybody, but if you enjoy this author, read this one soon.

These books are just fun to read!! Charlaine Harris has figured out that even a touch of magic is something we all want to have i her books, having magical creature there but not in the forefront of the story was a really fun read. can't wait for the next one.
Ok

Its always difficult when a favorite series ends. So with some trepidation I opened this book. I was pleasantly surprised. It was fun. I like the characters and can't wait to see what will happen next. While it may not be Sookie, it was still a fun read.
love it

I was very pleased to see a new Charlaine Harris book as I miss Sookie a lot! I enjoyed this book, it's not as good as the Sookie series but it is an enjoyable read. I love how there are always a few quirky characters in Charlaines books.

This was a fun read, and a good start to a new series. The characters were interesting and I enjoyed the town and the people in the town of Midnight. Note that this book is paced in a far more leisurely manner than the Sookie series!

It took me a good 80 pages to really get into this book but once I did I have to say I enjoyed it immensely. I loved all the characters, especially, "Mr. Snuggly". I think Charlaine Harris has another winner on her hands.

Charlaine Harris has done it again - created a "cast" of characters that are so fascinating you can't wait to get to know them!  Midnight Crossroad was a great read and I can't wait for the next book to come out!
Charlaine Harris is a great writer, I love all her books.
I was glad to read more about Manfred (I thought he was an interesting character in the Harper books).  Suspension of reality always needed in this type of book, but that's why I like to read.
All I can said is....... Wow, Wow and W ow!  Loved it!
I think C.H. did a great job writing this!  She has some awesome new characters and so many new ways to write stories for all of them.  I can't wait to see if there is a second book!
A great story that brings a minor character from another series to the forefront, while managing to be fresh and new. I devoured this in 2 days! Looking forward to the next one.
Great book but Charlaine's always are.  Thanks
Charlaine Harris has out done herself again!
Can't wait for the second book. I love the characters, especially the taking cat. Leaves you hungry to find out more about Midnight and it's mysteries.
Love the Sookie books. This first book of a new series does not disappoint.  Looking forward to #2 book. Thanks for making it available on Amazon.
I'm looking forward to the next book.  Interesting characters. Easy to read. I like the small town feeling.  I've really missed Charlaine Harris.
I have read many of her series. She takes a character from the Harper books and writes on him. I loved this book and would highly recommend it.
Loved the book, the characters, the hints of more to come.  Thought the ending a little weak, but the next installment might clear that up.
I am looking forward to the second book.
I love all of ms. Harris's books and Midnight Texas has captured my heart!!! Can't wait for the next book in this wonderful series!!
Super with a great cast of characters
Loving it so far! Almost done!!  I almost like it more than the Sookie books!! Love the quirky people and the town!

What a delightful collection of characters located in a small town in Texas.  When Manfred rents the house next to the pawn store he realizes that the employees there are a little different and the woman across the street can freeze people like statues.  Some similar characters to her Snookie series but I'm looking forward to learning more about the folks of Midnight Texas.
An enjoyable read, made me want to read more of her books. I am looking forward to the next book in the series.

I whole group of new characters, well developed and totally unique.  The author has pulled me in to the world of Midnight ,Texas and I want to know more about these loners who have settled in this off the beaten path place. kudos to Charlaine Harris

I have been anxiously awaiting this book, needing something to fill the void left by Sookie and the Bon Ton crew.  It starts out with a lot of good character development, but it is a slow start.  She gives very subtle hints as to the true nature of some of the more quirky residents of Midnight, but it's a long time for the pay off.  The ending was unexpected, and I love the fact that I hadn't figured it out by chapter 5.  I would definitely recommend this book, and I will purchase the next.  Well written, without a lot of fluff to fill the pages.
I can't wait for the next book in this series. Every bit as creepy & funny as the Sookie books.

I read the previous review of this book and still decided to purchase it and I am glad that I did. I enjoyed this book and the "new" characters. I have read and enjoyed the other series that this author has written, such as the Aurora Teagarden series, the Harper Connelly Series, and the Lily Bard Mysteries and was pleased to realize that several of the characters in this new series are characters that had roles in the other series that I listed. I found this new book to be an enjoyable read and I am looking forward to the next book with these characters.

When I saw Charlaine Harris had a new book out, I was anxious. Would it be a good as the grave books, as good as the Sookie Stackhouse books? And Yes it was, a interesting book filled with interesting people, I can wait to read more about the good people of Midnight!
I have been a fan of charlaine for years and she didn't disappoint. I feel connected with the people of midnight, as I do with sookie,I guess that's the best review I could ever give
Weird town, weird people and a bit mysterious. Great book. Roped me in. The ending caught me off guard completely.  Looking forward to the next one.

I am a big fan and long time reader of all of Ms. Harris's books and I am happy to say that I could not put this book down. There are so many surprises and guest appearances by characters from other books. I can't think of a better book to take to the beach or pool.
Enjoyed the characters and the quirkiness of Midnight,Texas. Will buy the next book in the series. Not Sookie but enjoyable.
I can say another hit as usually. What a style, what a mind to create stories that captures her writers.
Ms Harris is great as usual
Charlaine Harris is back!

I am a huge fan of the Lily Bard and Harper Connelly series and less so of the Sookie Stackhouse series.  I think that is why I loved this book. It can stand alone but you got to see old friends. The mystery slowly developed and there was no obvious - you saw it coming a mile away - solution, but it was solved in this book.  Then hours later you realize there were little mysteries hidden there that you missed.  Ones that will cause you to go back and reread the story - multiple times. Everyone has secrets but we didn't see most of them.... Where did the bodies go?  Where were the wings put?  What is/are Madonna and Teacher's secret(s)?  What is the reason she highlighted the juxtaposition of the antique store with a nail salon run by a gay couple?  What kind of harmful spells has she sold?  What is up with Rev?
Quick simple interesting
Another great story by Charlaine. I'm looking forward to more to this series!

I was very sorry that Charlaine Harris ended her Sookie Stackhouse series.  Her last book in that series "After Dead"  seemed almost a throwaway, a sop to her fans to tie up loose ends.  I was very disappointed in the format and the book.  I thought twice about buying "MIdnight CrossRoads", Because I have always enjoyed her writing, I decided give this series a try and am very happy I did.  It has a very odd grouping of characters, most of whom I enjoyed. I started reading it one evening, and it was finished two days later because I was so intrigued by the town of Midnight and its inhabitants and wanted to find out what happened to them. I am looking forward to the next one in the series.  I hope she will be doing more in her "Grave" series books also.
Loved it!  Great characters!  Totally kept me guessing until the end.
Just love her stories

If you only know Charlaine Harris from the Sookie Stackhouse books (a/k/a True Blood), you should definitely pick up her four-book series of Harper Connelly mysteries.  Then check out Midnight Crossroad, the first in a new series by Ms. Harris.  At times I feel that I am reading a screenplay, with stage directions and casting advice, so maybe she hopes for this series to go to TV like True Blood.  Nevertheless, it makes the reading very visual!  One of the primary characters in the tiny and strange little town of Midnight is Manfred Bernardo, whom I met, along with his psychic grandma, in one of the Harper Connelly mysteries.  I enjoyed every page of Midnight Crossroad.
Love Charlaine Harris's work-enjoyed this book a lot. Recommend!

Although this book starts a little slow, introducing characters, keep reading!  It becomes an interesting and enjoyable read.  Charlaine Harris can WRITE.  I read it in a day and a half, but I didn't want this book to end.  Spoiler Alert: One of my favorite things was that she uses some characters from other series that she has written, as characters in this book. Like finding Easter eggs, BoBo (from the Lily Bard Mysteries set in Shakespeare) and Manfred (from the Harper Connelly Mysteries) are already known to readers of Charlaine's other multiple series. This is added fun. My recommendation is: READ IT!

Charlaine Harris's wildly popular Sookie Stackhouse / Southern vampire series has come to a close, so Ms. Harris has unveiled a new and exciting set of characters in MIDNIGHT CROSSROAD. The quirky individuals of Midnight, Texas, all have their secrets, and I won't spoil a thing by giving details away. Suffice to say that newcomer Manfred has found a spiritual, as well as a physical, home for his psychic talents. There's a murder to solve and an arms-seeking extremist to unveil. There are townsfolk to shield and those to rely on. And don't forget the talents of a certain delightfully grumpy cat!

This is the best book I have read this year!  I did not think I would like this story even though I have been a Charlaine Harris fan for years.  Was I surprised.  I won't describe the story line as others have already done that. Ms. Harris has spent the time to really develop her characters and they are weird but delightful - even the scary ones.  The ending was a total surprise even though I am a mystery buff and probably read 100 or more mysteries a year.  Why everyone does not love this book is a mystery to me.  This series will be very popular and is appropriate even for teenagers.
Excellent read!

This book was typica Charlaine Harris fare - enjoyable, fun, easy read but slightly predictable if you have read her other series. It was great to see her writing from a viewpoint of a male character ( and a likable one at that ) . I enjoyed the different characters intermingled with some crossover favorites from other series. I am looking forward to the next book in the series so that she can continue to develop some of the backstories of her mysterious characters.
I did enjoy this book. It was different from Sookie but I think that is why I liked it. I hope the second book comes out soon.

The first few pages didn't grab me, but by the third chapter I started to get the story line. By the end I didn't want it to finish! Thanks again Charlaine! Loved the characters, they were quirky and interesting.

As usual, Charlaine Harris does not disappoint with something completely unique and creative. What I loved most about her writing style in previous books is the in depth character development and the way she sets a scene.  In this book, the characters are complex and all have secrets, and you are quite sure you don't know them all.  There is even a twist on the mystery that I didn't see coming.  I can't wait for the next book in the series!

I have read all of Charlaine Harris' novels and am so thrilled to meet new characters while greeting familiar faces. This book is the perfect kickoff to a new series that wraps a tidy bow on all the series I have come to love.
Loved how this tied in to the lily bard series. Can't wait for the next one! Or any new books from any of Charmaine's series!

I have to say it was not as good as I had hoped it would be... but then again I rate everything on the greatness of the Southern Vampire/Sookie Stackhouse series. I think it promises to be a good series... ending surprised me which is always a good thing. I just had trouble 'liking' the characters right away. I will look forward to the next edition and see where we go from there.

I'm only half way through the book and I love the series already.  Don't know why I didn't connect Manfred's name when I first ordered it but I'm very glad to see him in a story of his own.  The book so far is outstanding and I'm reading it too fast.  Hopefully the next books will come out sooner rather than later

I'm a fan of most of Charlaine Harris' books and not just the Sookie Stackhouse (True Blood) series.  This one lacked her usual humor and the voice seemed off.  Got off to a slow start and didn't really pick up steam.  I'll read the next one because I've liked the way she has written so I'm willing to give it a chance.

What can I say? I liked the town; I liked the people. I sped through the book and enjoyed all of it. It was a pleasant surprise, as I wasn't sure I'd like it. (Some of the Sookie Stackhouse books were just too grim for me.) But I really like Midnight, and hope to visit it again. Looking forward to knowing the people better.
Excellent!

A wonderful  journey to another reality: Charlalne Harris' reality, where  mythical creatures exist and anything can happen. It's also a murder Mystery. The mixed genre approach, as well as the interesting characters, both human and supernatural, make this book difficult to put down  until you come to the very end.
Can't wait for the next book
Good read
loved it!

This is not a Sookie Stackhouse tale filled with shape-shifters, vampires, fairies and other sinister beings.  This story has it's own cast of mysterious, interesting and intriguing characters and Ms. Harris's style of writing pulls you right in.  And unlike the Sookie series the story is told from several points of view which added to it's interest for me.  I enjoyed this story enormously and wish the second book were coming out sooner than next year.  It was nice that Ms. Harris references Lily Bard from the Shakespeare series (which I thought could have gone on longer than 5 volumes).  And, of course, we just met Manfred Bernardo the psychic in a short story in Games Creatures Play, the annual compilation edited by Toni L. P. Kelner and Ms. Harris.  Welcome to Midnight; an eerie little town.
Loved it and the twist..

I like a mystery that can stand alone, even if it refers to characters from other books.  This is a great little mystery in a fun town I'd like to visit again.  A strange little nexus of characters that go bump in the night, and people who say - Oh, OK!

I love Charlaine! I recommend reading the Harper Connelly, Lily Bard and Aurora Teagarden series beforehand.  You don't have to, but a lot of the characters overlap and gather together here in Midnight, Texas.  Easy, fun read.
Perfect
love it

Enjoyed and even laughed out loud at the cat! Would like a series on Manfred as he further explores and strengthen s his ability. Also like the Leeds/Bard connections. Those 2 keep popping up......more from them, too?????

After the final Sookie Stackhouse book I was not holding out high hopes for this book. I was pleasantly surprised when I was quickly pulled into the story. I am looking forward to the next installment of this series.

I was a huge Sookie Stackhouse fan and now with the new Midnight Crossroad I believe my fan base will grow. Love how Manfred is weaved into the new environment. Great book. Can't wait for the next edition.

I read quite a bit, and I have been aware of the author for a while, but I just haven't been able to get around to her (so many books, so little time)!  Thought this would be a good time to give her a try, since this is a new series.  Started it yesterday afternoon, finished it up a little after (what else?) midnight.  Held my interest from the very beginning.  More than one review/blurb has called this book a mash-up of different genres, and that's a good way of describing it, in a good way of course.  There is a mystery, and a supernatural element throughout, but one does not overpower the other, there is a balance between the two.  And you have the life in a small town aspect, out in the Texas boonies (I lived in south Texas for five years back in the 1980's, so I really enjoyed the setting).  There is a very interesting cast of characters, which I think she develops well.  All in all, I enjoyed the heck out of this book.  Oh, and one last thought.  I believe that this has been advertised as being the first in a series of three, and I hope that is the case.  However, this book can stand alone, as the story is actually wrapped up at the end.  Which I appreciated, especially after enjoying it so much as I got deeper and deeper into the story, I wasn't looking forward to having a cliffhanger ending.  With this new setting and cast of characters, the next books can take off in any number of directions.  I'm already looking forward to the next book in the series.  Midnight, Texas rocks!
Great collection of characters--several from pervious Charlaine Harris series!!-- and lots of mystery and spookiness. Can't wait to read the next Midnight, Texas book
I always enjoy Charlaine Harris's books, and was pleasantly surprised to find the characters in this new series were drawn from various other series written by her.

I see from the reviews of Midnight Crossroad that the Charlaine Harris "Hate-Mail Brigade" has taken the field yet again. Actually Midnight Crossroad is a hoot. I enjoyed it and found myself smiling at the author's clever twists and turns in the plot. Some characters were familiar and welcome in a new location.  Fiji is a delightful character and Lem is just hugable. I was surprised by the guilty party: didn't see that one coming at all. Beware the negative reviews of Harris's work. Some readers feel that buying an author's books somehow gives them ownership over the author's work and decisions, a bizarre concept. In this case, they seem outraged by how Harris ended the Sookie Stackhouse series. Personally, after watching two painfully obnoxious episodes of HBO's True Blood, I can only imagine how Harris, a true Southern lady, must have felt.  Had I been the author, I would have kicked the Stackhouse series into the back 40 as quickly as possible in response to that miserable HBO series.
Quite a change from the Sookie Stackhouse mysteries! I enjoyed every page! The town of Midnight and it's residents have hooked. Can't wait for the next book!
Thought at first that the book was too odd, and that I wouldn't like it. Kept reading and I was hooked. Very interesting and creative story. Enjoyed it very much
I liked it. Weird and quirky, just like her other books. The characters were very interesting and I couldn't wait to see what trouble would find them next.

I've enjoyed all of Charlaine Harris' mystery series through the years. I loved having Bobo Winthrop from the Lily Bard books, Manfred Bernardo from the Harper Connelly series, and Arthur Smith from the Aurora Teagarden series in the same book. These were all interesting characters and it was like revisiting old friends
I looked forward to reading Charlaine Harris' new book and I was not disappointed.  Her characters are great and it kept my interest in gear for every page.

Another page turner from Charlaine.  A marvelous cast of new off beat characters that you will love, in addition to some old friends.  I will be looking forward to the next adventure in Midnight, Texas.
So far, I like it. It took some time to get into the story but by the end I was loving the story line and the characters as well. Looking forward to the next one!

If you are looking for Sookie Stackhouse then this book is not for you. However, if you have read other series by Charlaine Harris you will appreciate this book. We still have some of the supernatural characters that inhabit the other series along with some quirky and funny characters thrown in for good measure. I hope she continues this series.

Although it was slow starting, this wonderful world of Midnight, Texas, grabs you and gives you characters you learn more and more about. See if you recognize,all the inside jokes Charliane sprinkles throughout the story. I would give this book 5 stars but for the slow start.
I really enjoyed this book and look forward to the next installment. Fun, quirky characters, all with secrets yet to be discovered. This is not deep literature folks, but it is a fun read.

Midnight Crossroad is the first book in the Midnight Texas trilogy by popular American author, Charlaine Harris. Midnight, Texas looks like a pretty standard dried-up western town, with lots of vacant buildings and few full-time inhabitants. The people who do live there, as new resident, psychic Manfred Bernardo soon discovers, are a bit unusual, although most are friendly and helpful. His landlord, Bobo Winthrop runs Midnight Pawn during the day; at night his basement tenants, the chilling Lemuel Bridger and the beautiful and very capable Olivia Charity take care of the business. Fiji Cavanaugh, self-proclaimed witch, runs The Inquiring Mind in a cottage left to her by her Great Aunt Mildred, along with her unusual cat, Mr Snuggles. The reclusive Reverend Emilio Sheehan looks after the Wedding Chapel and Pet Cemetery. Madonna Reed cooks wonderful meals at the Home Cookin diner. The aptly named Joe Strong runs the Antique Gallery and Nail Salon with his partner Chuy Villegas. Shawn Lovell runs the busiest concern in town, the Gas N Go, while keeping a tight rein on his pretty daughter, Creek and handful of a son, Connor. Not long after Manfred’s arrival, the body of Bobo’s missing girlfriend is discovered, and suspicion initially falls on Bobo. A pair of strangers also threatens the peace of the town, and Midnight’s residents take steps to protect their own. A diligent sheriff from nearby Davy, Arthur Smith is determined to flush out the killer. After a somewhat slow start as Harris sets the scene, the pace picks up and this novel is as intriguing and enjoyable as Harris’s other short series: Aurora Teagarden, Lily Bard and Harper Connelly. Fans of those series will recognise Bobo from Shakespeare’s Champion, Manfred from the Harper Connelly series, and Sheriff Arthur Smith from the Aurora Teagarden series. Harris peoples this series with interesting characters, her dialogue is witty and sharp, and the plot includes a vampire, white supremacists, gays, kidnapping, Halloween traditions, arson and a truly shocking climax. Readers who enjoy this instalment will look forward to the next book in the trilogy.

I really enjoyed Ms. Harris' latest, and I think the unfavorable comparisons to the Sookie Stackhouse series are unfair. Was this the action-packed, edge-of-your-seat-er that that last few Stackhouse books were? No. But it couldn't be. She had a lot of years and a lot of books to establish those characters and that universe - by the end, it was easy to jump right into the action, because all the introductory stuff was done 5 or 10 books before. We don't know who the people of Midnight, Texas are yet; that is what this book is for: to introduce these characters and this new world - or new segment of her other worlds, if you prefer - to provide a jumping-off point for future stories. By the end of the book, I genuinely cared about and was curious about these people, and I'm really looking forward to finding out more about them over the next few years. Here's hoping she's already working on #2!
Really liked it, quick easy read and would like to read a sequel l. Not as great as sookie though
Loved the characters, the story and the town! Another great book of one of my favorite authors. I can't wait to know more

Midnight Crossing revolves around a group of people living in a small town and how there lives intertwine over the period of a few weeks. I loved it. It is very much in the style of CH's other mystery books, The Aura Teagarten Mysteries and the Lilly Board books. In fact one of the charactors in this book is from Lillys series. He moved to the town at the end of the last Bard adventure. There is not a huge amount of action or anything really in these books. It is all about the relationships of the characters to each other and the landscape. When I finished this book I missed the people and their odd dynamic in my life. This will be a great series.
You know right from the start that things are not what they seem in this small town. Made me want to move to Midnight.
likable characters and easy to read story keep's things moving along. a twist or two that you don't expect make it worth reading.
Having read all of Charlaine' s books it was fun to see characters from her other series.  Good plot line with a lot of room to build on.
Loved the characters and the setting for story.  Vivid descriptions puts you there,  would have liked to find out more about Manfred and his "gift".

This is very small town with very big secrets. I enjoyed reading this book. A small town full of magic and magical creatures was a fun read. I will be following this trilogy and can't wait for the next installment. The mystery keeps you guessing through the book. I was completely surprised and had was totally unexpected.

Being a college student who has a lot of other "activities" I could be taking part of instead of reading, I have to say this book took hold of my relatively short attention span and held me in until the very last page. I feel that anyone who picks up this book will enjoy it immensely. Harris takes a unique approach to mythological creatures that have been favorites of all for generations (i.e vampires, witches etc.). You won't be disappointed, I highly recommend it. It's a book that if a movie was made, that followed the sequence of events and the script closely, it would instantly become one of my favorites

OK, there were alot of characters thrown at me in just the first few pages but they grew on me.  By the end, I was not ready to leave the tiny hamlet of Midnight Crossing because I was pretty sure something noteworthy would be happening while I was waiting for my next book.  Charlaine Harris has the story telling gift of making me feel as if I actually might know her characters - even the most outlandish of them. I got a little tired of the Sooky crowd, after a bit, but I loved every last moment of the Harper Connelly series so, I was glad a friend of Harpers had shown up in this book.

I liked that not all secrets got revealed.  Some moved the story along, some kept till the end, others were only hinted at, and at least one will hopefully reveal itself in the next book.  Cause there better be a next book! Liked seeing into the thoughts of the main characters with all their flaws open to us, just the way we think about ourselves, not hiding our foibles.
Once again Charlaine Harris is able to develop characters which I found engaging and interesting. I love the depth of her characters and felt as though I knew them.

Enjoyed this book all the way around!  Loved that it was set in Texas, all of the interesting characters, including Mr. Snuggles.  Can't wait to read the next book in the series.  I'm looking forward to finding out more about the residents of Midnight, Texas!
I enjoyed all the characters. I hope there is more to come now that the Sookie Stackhouse series is over.
Charlaine Harris has done it again.  She has created a community of people who happen to have eccentricities.  I am exited about future books in this series.  Well done!

I was a big fan of the Sookie Stackhouse mysteries. And Harris has not lost her touch. The reader does enter the "minds" of more characters whereas with the True Blood books you just had Sookie as the clear protagonist. This book proposes a small community as the protagonist. A fun read, light but captivating with a couple of fun surprises.
At times, the characters were confusing. The story's plot, however, was good. I can see potential if these characters and their relationships are developed.

Hooray for Charlaine Harris!  She has once again created a community where the bazaar and supernatural become family. I certainly pray there will many more to follow. I have got to get to know these people better.
Charlaine Harris has another winning series.  Fascinating characters.  A new twist on small town living.  Where will she take us next with these characters?

Having read most everything Charlaine Harris has written, I was concerned about an ensemble book featuring also-rans from her pre-Sookie series. However, I always liked Manfred Bernardo (from the Harper Connolly series) and certainly thought Bobo Winthrop (Lily Bard series) was a character who could stand to be fleshed out, so I gave it a try and I'm glad I did. I'll pick up the next book in this series when it comes out. It's nice to see Bobo all grown up (minor gripe: while it's perfectly normal for Southern men in small towns to have weird names in their hometown - my grandfather, Davis Bruce, was known as Doodle-Bug his whole life to his family - when they move, especially if they are trying to leave their past behind, they usually start using a grown-up version of their name. I hear there's an Aurora Teagarden crossover as well, but since that's the "most" in "most everything," (the series bored me after awhile), but I can't say who. That said, this book reminded me more of her earlier books, especially the Lily Bard series, and the last few Sookie books, where character and viewpoint shifts and the plot is in the interactions and small doings of a little Southern town, and not so much wild vampire sex and life-or-death supernatural politics. If you enjoy cozy mysteries with a drop of the supernatural, you'll like this. If you picked up the Sookie series because you have read every (repetitive and badly written) book Laurell K Hamilton has published and you wanted more vampire sex, you will hate this book. Like most cozies, the murder (off-screen and without detail to a disagreeable character) is not a central focus, and is simply there to provide a reason for character interaction. This book is more "Aunt Dimity" in Texas and less Anita Blake. Thank God.
One of Ms. Harris's best efforts to date.  This group of characters has the potential to be as entertaining as the "Sookie" book series.
She has written another spell binding story of just weird people. Her stories keep you hanging on chapter after chapter. I couldn't put it down until I finished it!

Another winner from Charlaine Harris.  This time the story is set in a small town called Midnight, Texas.  Manfred Bernardo has moved here following the death of his grandmother. What he finds is a very odd group of people.  Wonderful story and the characters keep you enthralled.

I love it Charlaine  Harris at her best. I could not put it down. I planed on it lasting me threw a road trip but read it all cover to cover. She always surprises me and know how to make you think and lol at the same time. Thumbs up for this one. :D

Charlaine Harris writes light, otherworldly mysteries that are good for those times when you want to be distracted and entertained, but not depressed. Midnight has a collection of oddball characters. I especially like the cat.
Loved the characters and story. Really liked the tie ins to the other books!  Quick and interesting story. Hope she does more for a series.

I really enjoy reading Midnight Crossroad.  I bought the book at a book signing and looked forward to reading it.  I love the cast of characters in the book.  While they did not all seem to fit in Midnight, Texas, I feel that was on purpose, to show how different each character is.  Midnight seems to be a place for misfits and this book brought each character to Midnight and brought friendship to people that are very different from each other.

Finally! I was so disappointed in the last couple of Sookie books (they seemed rushed and not as entertaining), Charlaine Harris has returned to the style I've enjoyed from her. Witty, creative, enjoyable; she blends the supernatural in with the natural in a way that is... well.... um.... NATURAL. There's no "wow" factor, it's just existence. I appreciated and respect it. Thanks for coming back!

I loved this start of a new trilogy. All of the characters were interesting & quirky. I am a fan of the Sookie Stackhouse books, but have never gotten into any of her other books. This book is exactly what I like about Ms. Harris. Well paced, fun & funny. Light reading for sure but total entertainment. Loved it, can't wait for the next one.
I loved that CH brought in characters from her other series into this book.  I can't wait for the next book in the series!

I GAVE THIS BOOK 4 stars be cause I really enjoy MS HARRIS Style of writing. Her books always surprise and entertain. Makes me anxious to see what is next.I love her regular stories full of strange characters.
Charlaine Harris does it again. Enjoyed the characters and the story line. Midnight, TX is a very interesting town to visit.
Midnight Crossroads introduces the reader to an interesting group of citizens of Midnight, Texas.  This promises to be yet another great series from Charlaine Harris.  I can't wait for the next one.
Another interesting book from Ms.  Harris.  A unique gathering of characters in a little Tx town. All with something special about them. There was a carry over from her series set in Shakespeare.
Ms Harris is an excellent writer, and I have enjoyed all her scenarios. The ending was neat. Looking forward  to next book.
This is a great book. I love the Sookie Stackhouse books & this one as we'll.  I highly recommend it.
Became addicted within the first few pages! I can't wait for the next! I fully recommend this book! It has it all!

I have loved all Charlaine Harris' previous books and series. Initially, I was not impressed with her choice of a main character...but he grew on me. I am still amazed at her ability to create eccentric characters  that I come to adore. I will look forward to the next book in this series, as I have with all her others. Ms. Harris, you done good. :)

Thank you Ms Harris for coming back. You tied up the "Grave Secrets" series beautifully with the kind of restraint more should show and brought in a wonderful new/old character. My favorite line in the whole book is "Little Timmy fell down the well" It starts off slow and never really rolls too fast but is a delightful read.

I adore the way she writes about people, they come alive in her books!  I plan to buy and read all of her books.  The Shakespeare stories with Lily Bard and Harper C. stories are all entwined to my delight with Midnight, Texas.  She always has a few surprises that are delightfully unexpected.

It was great going back to Manfred's story.  I liked that the story was more about the town than any one person.  So instead of one interesting character you have a whole towns worth.  Sometimes the story seems to move slowly but than I realized I was getting to know the characters and I enjoyed the pacing.  I read it in one day and wish I had the next installment to dive into!

Midnight is a quirky, maybe a little spooky, town. If you read Charlaine's Harper books you will recognize Manfred Bernardo, psychic. Manfred moves to Midnight. He's finds a place where his eccentricities are accepted, because every resident has them. The residents are not perfect or even always smooth, but throughout the book each character develops and we learn a bit more about them. There's a murder, a white supremacy group and lots of secrets.  I really enjoyed this newest book and look forward to the next installment!

I love Charlaine Harris's imagination! Here is another real great tale I hope goes on for awhile because you can really feel that you are part of the story and has some interesting characters living there. Midnight,Texas will work its way into you like Bon Temps, did. You will want to put this book on your "to be read" list.

Just needed a bit more on the plot in this book, but the basic characters are good - a bit unlikely, but isn't that the point?  Good stories yet to be told about the Rev, the owners of the antique and nail salon, the newcomer, etc.  I felt this was the first chapter and the story is yet to be told.  Hope there's more of a plot and suspense in the next one!
I liked this story, and I really liked the characters! I think there's potential for a darn good series here. I hope to see more.

Somehow when I pre-ordered this book I missed that some of my favorite characters from other Charlaine Harris series are in it. Needless to say, I read it in one sitting the first time. & now I'm reading it again to savor it at a slower pace. &  I must admit that I am grieved that I have to wait who knows how long for the next book in the series since it just came out. . . can't wait to see what happens next in the series.
Ms Harris knows how to tell a story. I want to read more more about these new characters. Bring Them

I've been reading Charlaine Harris's books since way before the TV show and I really enjoy them.  This one was well worth reading - mostly due to how fascinating the characters were.  It starts out a bit rough with too much exposition, but it kept getting better and better.  I'm definitely interested in where she will go from here.
This book made me laugh out loud.  Every character had their own little quirks and made the whole story come together.
Not her typical Sookie characters.  It took me a little while to get into this plot, but once I did, I enjoyed it.

I wasn't sure about this book at first, but as I read it, I thoroughly enjoyed getting reacquainted with some of the more interesting secondary characters from Ms. Harris' other series. I'm very intrigued by the new characters she's added, and I can't wait for the next book in this series.

No matter what Charlaine Harris writes, and I think I've read everything, her characters charm me and make me feel as if they could be my friends. Perhaps this is really a 3.5, but it was enjoyable and intriguing. I'm glad she has a new series I can look forward to reading.

I did not want it to end. Being a seasoned reader, it is hard for me to find a book that is enthralling, funny, frightening, and impossible to put down ... Charlaine, Please write more than three of these novels of Midnight and it's residents ... and HURRY!!!

I enjoyed this book. It was a pleasant read, very character-driven, and I'm interested in finding out what happens next. There's not a ton of action, but the revelations about the characters are well paced and it kept me interested to the end.

I truly enjoyed the story line and am looking forward to the next one.  Per usual Ms. Harris has a widely unusual cast of characters from the normal to the abnormal.  It is amazing what can happen in a small community in nowhereville.

I don't know how you feel, but I'm awfully glad that the Sookie Stackhouse series, with the massively popular TRUE BLOOD HBO series, didn't completely derail Charlaine Harris' writing career. I've always enjoyed her other series, so I'm especially pleased to see this new Midnight, Texas series begin. The off-beat characters, most with something "a little extra," are engaging and multilayered. Manfred, the psychic/showman from the Stackhouse novels, starts to evolve and grow and we get to learn about him as he finds out about himself. The action is fast-paced and, somehow, the supernatural is made plausible. I look forward to more of this engaging new series, but, then, I'm always a sucked for a talking cat of Mr. Snuggles ilk.
It's the beginning of a new great series by Ms. Harris! I loved the characters.

This book was wonderful! It has interesting characters and a great story line. A fast, easy, fun read! I can't wait for the next book in this series.  Charlaine Harris is one of my very favorite writers.
A great start to a new series by Charlaine Harris.  The book is filled with quirky characters, each with their own secrets.  I'm looking forward to reading more about the residents of Midnight.
I can't wait to read the next book. The charter development is wonderful.
I enjoyed this book and look forward as for what's to come in this new series. This is the 1st book in the series so I didn't expect all that much however it was pretty good
Perfect for a quick entertaining summer read by the pool or beach!

This is a far cry from the Sookie Stackhouse series but so far it is a very interesting read.  It had me wondering what these people were, where they all came from and wondering what they are.  It is a bit slow at first but then picks up and gets more spell binding.  I would recommend this book for any that are interested in sci-fi and mystry come together.  Well done.
Great new 'branch' series using an intriguing character from a previous series - looking forward to seeing where the characters go!
Love Charlaine Harris' books.  Midnight Crossroad gives the reader imagination and imagery in a familiar Harris world.  Can't wait for the next book in this new series!
While I am sorry the Sookie series ended (all good things do) this feels like it will be quite interesting.
Character development is lovely in this little book.  I very much enjoyed reading this, and hope there is an entire Midnight series.

I've been looking forward to the release of this book and was not disappointed. I devoured it in one day. Manfred, who is a character in several other novels has moved to Midnight, Texas. The town is full of people with secrets. We learn some of those secrets in this novel. I'll be looking for the next novel in this trilogy.

Charlaine Harris has another winning cast of characters and I can hardly wait for the next of what I assume is a new series. If you've loved True Blod, you'll love this one too. The cat is a caution and the humor is great!
Item as described, fast shipper!!! Highly reccomend!!
Enjoyed the story and all the colorful characters.
Excellent, Item delivered on time, was as described, will buy again recommend to ALL!!!
Great follow-up to the Sookie series, can't wait for the next installment!
Great

I am a huge fan if this wonderful author.  I have read almost every word she's written, and truly enjoyed almost all of it.  This book is no different.  I love how she brings characters from one series into another, seemingly just as a treat for her readers.  But this time, she made one of the more minor characters in her Harper Connelly novels one of the main characters in this book.  There is more than a bit of the paranormal in this book, but it has a very different feel than her other series.  Each series has its own personality and I just fall in love with them.  This small Texas town houses some great characters.  I truly couldn't put it down.
Amazing and can't wait to read the next one!!!!!
Enjoyable read.

This book is wonderful, both on its own and as a staging for things to come in a series.  One of the things I like best about Harris is the easy, comfortable way she has of doing narrative.  It feels as if a friend who speaks like you do is telling the story.  That's no different here.  It does forgo the first person narrative but that's no sacrifice since the story is as wonderfully told as any Sookie book.  She also spreads the wealth in storytelling, letting you get to know intimately (after a bit) most of the residents of Midnight and they are an intriguing, well thought out bunch.  Oh and something I only realized near the end?  We have a psychic, a vampire, a witch, and maybe even a shifter and the main adversity they face are not  any that couldn't have happened to totally human characters, which just adds to how I and probably everyone else can relate to them!

I love Harris' work. I read the entire Sookie series, as well as her Lily Bard series and a handful of one-off books. With Midnight, Texas she took one of the best characters from the Harper Connelly series, Manfred Bernardo, and gave him his own book. The characters, mystery, and town are absolutely delightful. Highly recommended, and can't wait for the next one.
Enjoyed the new characters from Charlaine Harris.  Especially Mr. Snuggly (but I am a cat lover).  Will miss my beloved Sookie but maybe this group can take over

I'm a fan of Charlaine Harris. Have enjoyed all of her series.  This first in a new series didn't disappoint. The characters are interesting, varied and well-rounded. All of her series are different from each other. In each she tells a good story. I am looking forward to the next and the next and the next.........

I have to say I really love this new series. Midnight and its zany citizens are wonderful. The mystery is intriguing but it is the lives and personalities of the characters that kept me turning the pages. I was left wanting MORE book:) I cannot wait for the next installment of this series. Charlaine Harris gets a perfect score with this wonderful new series.
Love the characters & the story! Charlaine Harris has created another great series! I can't wait to read the next book in the trilogy!
The quirky cast of characters drew me in right away and the story was a quick and intriguing read. Hope there's another midnight book soon!
After Sookie and the Grave series' I didn't know if Harris could do it again.  I really enjoyed Midnight Crossing.  Another book filled with likable characters.

Having read the sookie novels and loving them I gave Midnight Crossroads a try and I am glad I did. The style and tempo of the book are very different from what I was expecting but this introduction to a whole new cast of characters proves intriguing and engaging.
This is a very different book by Charlaine Harris, I loved it! It reads easy and keeps you interested the whole time. Great characters, each had their own unique roles and abilities, great book!
I really enjoyed it even though I didn't remember the characters from Dead in Dallas.  I like all of Charlaine Harris' series, and am looking forward for the next one in the Midnight, Texas series!
Enjoyable. Different from herlast book. Answers some questions but leaves you asking more about each character. Want the next book!
The small town and unique setting gets you from the start. If you like Sootie Stackhouse this is for you. Waiting for the next book is a little disappointing. I want to know what happens next.

So great that she's created a new trilogy and it's off to a great start! I was so excited that she's brought back Manfred from the Harper books - he's a great character. I liked all of the other characters and am looking forward to how the storyline progresses.
I liked the story. I had enjoyed the story line that this spun off of. Hopefully this series will grow, and we will have more insight into this town.
Charlaine Harris has done it again.  Same universe but new area and set of characters we get to know and love.  Did not see twist at the end coming at all.
I loved this book so much!  I can't wait to hear more from the residents of Midnight!  My only complaint about this book?  It wasn't nearly long enough!
I was sad to say good bye to Harper and Sookie but now I can't wait to become better acquainted with Manfred and the other citizens of Midnight, Texas.

Some of the best characters in the best setting imaginable. A fascinating plot with twists only a mystery writer of her talent could conceive of. Just awesome. I hope there are more than three stories about Midnight. That's really the only downside. READ THIS BOOK.

It's always nice when an author takes a minor character and gives you stories about them.  In this delightful book, not one but two minor characters appear.  I'm looking forward to more from Midnight, Texas.
I've read all of Harris's series. Loved all the characters from past series brought together. This book was a truly enjoyable read

This was a great read! My only regret is that I have finished it and there are no more. I had the good fortune to discover Ms. Harris and read her different book series after they had all been released and I am disappointed, having finished this one, that this is all there is for now. I was thrilled to have an expansion of Manfred's character as it is her characterization of him that I find most compelling. I must said that the anthropomorphism of the cat really threw me but in the end it was simply as camp as the rest of the book and added another character somehow comparable to the ones that had already been developed in this tiny town. This is a book that anyone at any age level could read. Certainly ideal for Potter fans since it is built on strong and very different characters trying to find a safe haven.

A little mystery, a little action, a lot of character. I especially like how Harris seamlessly switches POV in a way that should have been impossibly awkward but instead succeeds nicely. Huge potential for this series!

This story brings together old friends from Ms Harris' other series.  A mystery with a touch of weirdness mixed in, the characters are relatable and likeable.  A promising series with lots of possibilities.

I cannot wait to see what else will become of the Midnight family.  while this book started off kind of slow,  it did not dissapoint.  I love Charlaine Harris and any book she writes.  I was shocked at the turns, and twist in the plot.  left me speechless.  great read highly recommend book to her fans.  I also love all the characters she threw in from her other series as well.  Great way to include.  This series will definitely make its way to the top as the rest of her have.

I've been a fan of all of Ms. Harris' works, and loved this quirky tale. Fans of her previous fiction will recognize a number of the characters in this novel, including Bobo, Manfred, and Arthur Smith, from the Lily Bard, Harper Connelly, and Aurora Teagarden mysteries respectively. Having said that, familiarity with any of those series is not a necessity; it is, however, a lovely nod to longtime fans.  Midnight Crossroad isn't the most action-packed novel, but the characterizations and subtlety kept me turning the pages as I fell in love with the ambience and wanted to learn more about the town and its off-beat residents. Part of the slow pace may be the author setting up the trilogy, but I enjoyed the slightly dark & humorous tone, and cannot wait for more. Ms. Harris never fails at hitting the nail on the head when it comes to human emotions and needs, and her unique packaging creates a work that draws you in to the human condition while somehow keeping you grinning enough to see through to the emotional highs and lows that make up this thing we call life.  (Hopefully that didn't sound too ponderous.)  (Edited solely for grammatical errors I caught retroactively. I can't STAND seeing myself commit a grammatical atrocity.)
I fully enjoyed the first book in this new series. I was able to read it without being bored. I hope the rest if the series is quick to follow.

Loved loved loved this book! Charlaine does it again. Great story great and great characters! I can't wait till the next one comes out. If you are a fan of Charlaine's work then you will also enjoy this book.

Charlaine has done it again! This is one mysterious town and so are the characters. I really enjoyed trying to discover all the little quirks about the townspeople and tying my darnedest to figure them all out. Charlaine has a way to make the extraordinary supernatural feel down right normal (in a good way) and really ties three of her previous series all together. I can't wait for the second book and I feel a bit sadden that I read this so quickly. If you enjoyed her previous works, you will enjoy this book.
Another world to love from Charlaine Harris. Suddenly, I'm not so lonely for the stack house series. I feel like I know the characters already and I can't wait for more.

Great mystery set in a small tow.  Very unique cast of characters, loved the vibe.  Totally different from the Sookie series,  but really a great read.  I hope there are more books set in Midnight.

Wonderful story with a villain I didn't see coming. You have a . Mystery the Supernatural, physic. Great writing. Wonderful characters. Excitement galore. ENJOY
